description: White Mouse is a simple puzzle game where a white mouse, controlled by the computer, tries to escape from the playfield. By placing kitty paws on the field, the player attempts to encircle the mouse, until it cannot move anymore. The game is played from a top-down view and the levels are randomly generated. The goal is to use as few turns as possible to catch the mouse.
title: White Mouse

description:
Vektrax is a 3D gravity racer game where the player is put in control of a spaceship racing down a tube, tilting the iPhone to control the steering. The player must race from checkpoint to checkpoint before their time runs out with the track twisting, splitting, and even unfolding and folding make in on itself (so the player is racing along the outside, not the inside).

The ship is equipped with an automatically (but slowly) regenerating shield which absorbs laser shots and even the occasional head-on collision with the other enemy craft also racing down the track. The player must shoot the enemies to gain fuel which can be used boost the ship faster (or to upgrade the ship's weapons to a quad-shot spray). The game goes on for as long as the player has time left on the clock, and comes with 3 difficulty levels to play at.

sample_screenshots.caption: On the outside of the tube

title: Vektrax

description:
Tap Tap Revenge is a musical rhythm game in the tradition of Guitar Hero or Dance Dance Revolution, but adapted specifically for the iPhone / iPod Touch platform.

Offering a selection of songs including artists such as Weezer, The Offspring, Q-Tip, Katy Perry, Kaiser Chiefs, Everlast, Michael Franti and more, notes shown as bubbles glide along three beams on the screen towards the player, who needs to tap them timely (using the touch screen) when they cross the bottom screen border. Next to taps, there are also arrows where the player needs to shake the device left, right or down, using the accelerometer function. Not missing any notes provides a score multiplier of two, three, four and eventually eight times the basic points (called the Revenge mode).

There are four difficulty levels (easy, medium, hard and extreme). At the end of each song, the score, accuracy and longest streak are shown. The score can also be registered online and regularly there are contests held on the official site. New songs are offered on a regular basis. Multiplayer is available for two players simultaneously on a single device, having each player tap a part of the screen with the two sections blending in the middle. In this mode, no shaking is used, only tapping.
title: Tap Tap Revenge

description:
Tap Tap Dance is the sequel to Tap Tap Revenge and unlike the first game it is not released for free. The game uses the same tapping and shaking mechanics of the first game to match the rhythm of the music tracks. The tracklist includes the following songs:* Justice - Phantom Pt.II (Soulwax Remix)

  • Moby - Disco Lies (The Dusty Kids Fears Remix)
  • Sunny Levine - Daylight (Morgan Page Remix)
  • Daft Punk - Technologic
  • Digitalism - Zdarlight
  • Junkie XL - Stratosphere
  • The Chemical Brothers - Midnight Madness
  • Tiësto - Goldrush
  • Soul Magic Orchestra - Compressor
  • Basement Jaxx - Where's Your Head At

There are four new graphical themes to accompany the music, redesigned menus and the multiplayer mode for two players simultaneously has remained. Instead of using the CPU to render the graphics like the first game, it was ported to OpenGL by Guy English and independent developer Mark "Doomlaser" Johns.

The basic game mechanics were updated with a few techniques: multi-tap notes and tap-and-hold. There are four difficulty levels, with a different playlist and a special track at the end. When players do well in the regular tracks (based on accuracy), they are unlocked and offer new themes. These special levels were designed by the independent developers Kevin Coulton and Jonatan "cactus" Söderström. All other levels of the songs (as well as those of the first game) were made by Nick Gallant.
title: Tap Tap Dance

description:
Christmas With Weezer uses the game mechanics (including multitaps and tap-and-hold) and the engine of Tap Tap Dance to offer a skinned version of the game based around the rock band Weezer. The basic premise of tapping and shaking the screen to match the music's rhythm has remained, but this title includes six Christmas holiday songs performed by the band:* Oh Come All Ye Faithful

  • First Noel
  • Hark The Herald Angel Sings
  • O Holy Night
  • Silent Night
  • We Wish You a Merry Christmas

There are new festive themes with snow and the bubbles on the beams have been replaced by presents. New to the series is a Kids mode where the game cannot be lost and where feedback is given instantly based on the accuracy. Levels need to be completed one by one. When the Hard difficulty mode is unlocked, two songs of the band's Red Album become available:* Pork and Beans

  • The Greatest Man That Ever Lived

At the end of the game a video of the band is shown.
title: Christmas With Weezer

description: Tap Tap Revenge: NIN Edition uses the game mechanics and the engine of Tap Tap Revenge to offer a skinned version of the game based around the rock band Nine Inch Nails with thirteen tracks from their albums The Slip and Ghosts I-IV. The basic premise of tapping and shaking the screen to match the music's rhythm has remained, but with slight modifications to the gameplay. It is now easier to reach the Revenge mode. New difficulty levels need to be unlocked and the general themes have been adapted to the band. The multiplayer function for two players using the device simultaneously is also available.
title: Tap Tap Revenge: NIN Edition

alternate_titles.title: Newtonica 2: Return of the Baby Bird

description:
Help the baby bird get to its mother. Touch the black sphere on the touch screen to send out a cosmic wave which will push the bird away. Time your touch and move the sphere so that the bird makes it to the goal successfully! Obstacles that the bird can bump into may either change its course, or simply stop it from moving any further. The game is over if the bird doesn't reach the goal or floats off the screen.

Newtonica 2 is a sequel to the iPhone game Newtonica. Unlike the previous game, Newtonica 2 is more puzzle-based, and has set levels for the player to clear, rather than one continuous goal.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level select - a new level will have a checkered pattern on it.
Tap the black sphere to push the bird to the goal.

title: Newtonica 2

description:
iPentris is a new incarnation of the classic game concept of Tetris, where five fields are used for each block. This makes the game more challenging, but iPentris rewards the player on each level with a bonus item that cleans up the playfield on activation.

The overall goal of the game is to build up a rocket. On each level, the player gets a new piece for the rocket, which is then shown on the background image. Once the rocket is complete, it starts off and the game continues in a space environment.

The game features a global highscore list, so that players from all around the world can compete.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting the game with some easy blocks.

title: iPentris

description: Raptor Copter a loose follow-up to Off-Road Velociraptor Safari. Similar to the first game, players need to capture raptors and transport the meat to an extraction point. Only this time the player does not control a jeep in a full 3D environment, but a Chinook helicopter in 2D side-scrolling gameplay. Apart from that, the basic concept of the game is the same; raptors can be caught using a spiked ball dangling from the helicopter and points are earned when the meat is transported. The game interacts with the online Blurst website for achievements.
title: Raptor Copter

description:
Ben Stein: It's Trivial is a trivia game for the iPhone/iPod Touch featuring witty voice talent from Ben Stein and bobble-head caricatures that react to the angle and movement of the device.

The focus of the game is answering multiple-choice trivia questions in four categories of questions pulled from of pool of more than 1200. Players must answer the questions correctly to continue through all three difficulty rounds in the pursuit of earning points. There are also Bonus Lightning Questions in each category which increase bonus multipliers and keep the player's points safe.

If successful in keeping Cheex the Monkey from falling off the vine, players can bank their points or use them to have Cheex steal items of Ben Stein's personal "stuff" using a parody of the App Store. Once the player has stolen all of Ben's stuff (which can take upwards of 150 rounds of trivia), they have successfully beat Ben Stein!
title: Ben Stein: It's Trivial

description:
GW Helmet is a remake of one of the 1981 Gold Game & Watch games that came on a single, LCD device. Known as Helmet, in the UK it was known by the name Headache.

Players need to move a character from the door on the left side of the screen to the shed on the right side. Once he gets through, the game continues from the left side. The graphics have been updated with touches of colour. As in the original game, there is no fluent movement animation, but only a set amount of steps the character can take. While traversing over the screen, he has to avoid tools such as hammers, saws and wrenches. Each group of tools that is avoided is awarded with one point, making it to the shed gives five points and at 300 points a bonus is provided.

Movement is done by tilting the device left or right, tapping the desired location or pressing the left or right edge of the screen. As in the original game, there are two game modes with a different difficulty level.
title: GW Helmet

description:
This is a port by Hudson of the PC game Crayon Physics Deluxe and optimized for the iPhone and iPod Touch. This version includes most of the enhancements the PC version has compared to the original prototype Crayon Physics, including a level editor. Only three levels can be saved however and they cannot be shared with other users.

Instead of the islands with different level paths, this version has a strict level progression with 50 different levels (less than the original game). The goal for each of the levels is to move a red ball so it hits one or more stars. Players use their finger to draw physical objects of different colours which can move the ball, block it or provide a bridge. The objects interact with each other as well as with the environment. Objects can also be erased. When the ball falls off the screen, it reappears at its original relocation. It is also possible to reset an entire level by shaking the device.

The game is played against a scrap paper background and all objects have a crayon art style. By pinching on the screen, it is possible to zoom in on the game elements. Scrolling is done by dragging the screen with two fingers.
title: Crayon Physics Deluxe

description:
GW Chef is a remake of one of the 1981 Wide Screen Game & Watch games that came on a single, LCD device.

Players need to move a chef to the left or the right side of the screen to keep all items of food in the air. Meanwhile, a hungry mouse is waiting at the bottom for the food that is dropped. In the second game mode, there is also a cat in a basket on the left side of the screen who interferes with the action and can hold food in the air for a longer amount of time. The graphics have been updated with touches of colour. As in the original game, there is no fluent movement animation, but only a set amount of steps the character can take. Each item of food tossed and at 300 points a bonus is provided.

Movement is done by tilting the device left or right, tapping the desired location or pressing the left or right edge of the screen. As in the original game, there are two game modes with a different difficulty level. In the first one three sets of food need to be tossed, in the second one there are four.
title: GW Chef

description:
GW Octopus is a remake of one of the 1981 Wide Screen Game & Watch games that came on a single, LCD device.

Players control a diver who need to search the ocean floor, grabbings items from a treasure chest on the right while avoiding the tentacles of an octopus on the right side of the screen. As in the original game, there is no fluent movement animation, but only a set amount of steps the character can take. The graphics have been updated with touches of colour. Each item collected is awarded with one point, returning to the boat with loot gives three points and at 300 points a bonus is provided.

Movement is done by tilting the device left or right, tapping the desired location or pressing the left or right edge of the screen. As in the original game, there are two game modes with a different difficulty level.
title: GW Octopus

description:
GW Parachute is a remake of one of the 1981 Wide Screen Game & Watch games that came on a single, LCD device.

Players control a character sitting in a boat on a river. The boat needs to be moved left or right to catch all the parachuters before they drop in the stream, where a shark awaits them. As in the original game, there is no fluent movement animation, but only a set amount of steps the character can take. The graphics have been updated with touches of colour. Each caught parachuter is awarded with one point and at 300 points a bonus is provided.

Movement is done by tilting the device left or right, tapping the desired location or pressing the left or right edge of the screen. As in the original game, there are two game modes with a different difficulty level.
title: GW Parachute

description:
GW Fire is a remake of one of the 1980 Fire Game & Watch games that came on a single, LCD device.

Players control two characters carrying a stretcher who need to catch the people jumping down from a burning building to bounce them into an ambulance waiting on the right side of the screen. As in the original game, there is no fluent movement animation, but only a set amount of steps the character can take. The graphics have been updated with touches of colour. Each caught character is awarded with one point and at 300 points a bonus is provided.

Movement is done by tilting the device left or right, tapping the desired location or pressing the left or right edge of the screen. As in the original game, there are two game modes with a different difficulty level.
title: GW Fire

description: Reversi and Sexy girl is a version of the classic board game Reversi for the iPhone (and iPod touch) that pits the player against a cute girl with cow ears and tail. Reversi is played on an eight-by-eight grid and the pieces have two sides—white and black. Players must sandwich their opponent's pieces between their own, which changes the color, "capturing" the pieces. The player with the most pieces on the board when it is completely filled is the winner. There are three difficulty modes.
title: Reversi and Sexy girl

description:
Trism is a puzzle game designed around the iPhone's ability to touch the screen and tilt it. The screen is filled with a board of triangles (or 'Trisms'), and the player can clear away Trisms by making three or more of the same color touch. These Trisms then disappear, and more slide on-screen. The direction that the new Trisms slide in from is determined by the position that the player holds the iPhone. A skilled player can use varying directions to their advantage, allowing for combos of multiple Trisms being cleared.

To complicate matters, Trisms occasionally get 'screwed in', meaning that all the Trisms on that row can no longer be moved, and instead must be cleared to restore the row back to normal. Other Trisms may become bombs with timers on them - if the player doesn't clear these dangerous Trisms before the timer runs out, the bomb explodes and it's Game Over!

Trism has three different modes of play:* Infinism - play for as long as you can! There's no time limit here, it's just the bombs that can end your game.

  • Terminism - a timed game - keep clearing those Trisms to stay in the game!
  • Syllogism - a puzzle mode where you have a set amount of moves to clear all the Trisms in play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sometimes, Rainbow Trisms will be created - these act as wildcards.
As you clear Trisms, more fill the screen.
You can check out what kind of achievements you've unlocked.
The green Trism has been screwed in - you won't be able to move any rows it's on.
The grey Star Trisms allow you to move a line without it snapping back.

title: Trism

description:
Bank Panic (completely unrelated to the arcade game of the same name) is a game presented in the style of Nintendo's classic Game & Watch game series and similar to GW Fire for the same platform, based on the original 1980 Fire game. Stock market prices are plummeting, and suicidal investors are jumping out of the windows. Catch them before they hit the pavement!

The player must move the two firefighters to catch the investors as they quickly jump out of the windows. The arc of their jump and the window they jump out of varies, meaning that their landing positions are unpredictable.

Bank Panic also has the option to get the latest Dow Jones stock quotes. The lower the figures, the faster those investors will keep jumping.
title: Bank Panic

description:
Subway Shuffle is a puzzle game that starts out simply enough - get your red subway train to the red exit. However, other trains also get in the way on intersecting lines, causing obstructions. You'll need to shuffle the trains around the various lines to get the red train you're riding to its destination.

Each subway train can only follow its similarly colored line - red trains pass along red lines, blue trains along blue lines, and so on. Each puzzle also has its "ideal" solution with a set number of moves that it can be completed in.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some puzzles have other red trains on the track - compounding your problem!
A little bit tougher, but still manageable
If you get stuck, you can rewind your previous moves.
There are loads of increasingly mind-bending puzzles to play.

title: Subway Shuffle

description:
Newtonica is an action game where players must catch meteors by dragging and flicking a pink and purple colored sphere. The meteor's colored shadow can be seen as it approaches the sphere - simply rotate the sphere so that the correct color matches up when it lands.

The more meteors you catch, the more intense the music will become, and the more your life gauge will fill. When all ten bars fill, you will level up, the meter will reset back to three and you must catch more meteors to fill it again. If you land a meteor in the wrong colored section of the sphere, your life will lose a bar. Lose all of your life, and it's game over.

Occasionally, an Astro Baby Bird will fly through space. Tap the bird for some bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen shows your best scores.
Tap the baby bird before it flies off-screen!
If you tilt the iPhone, the screen will automatically adjust the HUD for you.
As the meteors get close, you can see them approach.
Lost all my life - game over.

title: Newtonica

description:
Dr. Awesome is the newest surgeon at the hospital, tasked with saving patients from various viruses and bacteria, and working up through the ranks from Student to Expert Microsurgeon, but with one complication—many of the patients are acquaintances of Dr. Awesome's!

The player uses the tilt function of the iPhone to cut away at infected cells. Cutting away more than 75% of the cell kills the infection and ends the level, saving the patient. Run out of time and the patient is harmed—do it repeatedly and the patient dies. Patients can also die if left unattended too long—once a patient appears on the queue, Dr. Awesome must attend to them within a day or they will die on their own. Patient names are taken straight from the iPhone's address book, so the player might find themselves operating on some familiar-sounding patients.

sample_screenshots.caption: Patient names are taken from your contacts (if no contacts exist, generic names like this are used)
Cutting off pieces of the cell

title: Dr. Awesome: Microsurgeon M.D.

description:
Fly through the sky, guiding your ball through a neon-lit maze. Navigate the ball to the blue slalom tiles that appear as the maze scrolls, but watch out for the pokey Tanks, the stationary but lethal Turrets, and the Über Tanks that will hunt you down the moment they spot you.

Although the player is navigating through a maze, they have complete freedom to move each wall tile around. They can either tap one tile, then the other, or drag between the two tiles. This will swap it for any other tile on the play field - unless an object, such as an enemy or the player ball is in the way. Using this mechanic, the player can trap enemies away to prevent them from escaping, or forge their own path to the slalom tile (slalom tiles are the only ones that cannot be moved).

The player can also tilt the device to physically move the ball around the playfield. The amount of speed the ball moves around depends on how much tilt is applied, and can allow the player to get out of otherwise dangerous situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each one of these neon tiles can be moved to any position on the grid.
Enemies such as the Tank begin to appear, as do pick-ups.
Dragging a blue tile out of the way to reach the slalom below.

title: Neonscape

description:
In Ruben & Lullaby the player is called in as a spectator when the lovers Ruben and Lullaby are having their first fight while sitting on a bench in a park. Called an opertoon by the developers - part comic, part game, part musical instrument - the player can choose to remain passive and let the conversation unfold, or interfere and steer the outcome. Although no words are spoken and no text appears to explain their feelings, it is up to the player to decide when they talk to each other (implied) and how they react.

This is done using the motion control of the mobile device. By tilting it left or right, the player decides who is speaking or reacting, shifting the screen to close in on the character of choice. They can be enraged by shaking the device (the screen turns red) or by gently rubbing it (the screen turns blue). Through this mechanic, the implied flow of the fight is decided by the player - who speaks? who's silent? - eventually leading up to a reunion or a break-up. Music and sound is also interwoven. The jazz arrangement adapts to the emotions; hi-hats building up rage, a piano chord when shifting the focus, the bass announcing tensions, brass softening the atmosphere. As such, the sound and drawn graphics are the only lead to follow the story.
title: Ruben & Lullaby

description: SCRAP! is a game for the iPhone, following the general tradition of building-block type games where you complete lines in exchange for points. The twist that makes SCRAP! interesting is that the orientation you must complete lines in, switches at random and is highlighted along one side of the game board. In lieu of gravity, you have a given amount of time (dependent on your current level/difficulty) to place the piece before it is moved to the SCRAP! pile. Pieces can be retrieved from the SCRAP! pile (limit one per turn) and placed on the game board. Don't let the pile build up too much, or your game will come to an end.
title: SCRAP!

description:
Vector Tanks is a firstperson tank shooter with retro-styled vector graphics. It is designed by Peter Hirschberg, the inventor of the translucent vector effect technique in the mid 1990s.

The premise is simple: the player commands a tank on the battlefield and needs to blast all enemies to bits. The tank is controlled through two gauges, one on each side of the screen. Much like vertically-oriented analogue sticks, players need to move them up or down using the touch screen to move forward, backward and turn. Tapping the screen makes the tank fire. There are two types of enemies, the battlefield is filled with mines and obstacles, and next to regular shells power-ups such as a shield, rapid fire and a nuke can be picked up.

The screen shakes visibly when taking damage or landing heavy fire, and new enemies spawn as soon as the old ones are destroyed. The game keep track of the player's overall score.
title: Vector Tanks

description:
Rolando is a platform adventure in which the player must rescue small creatures called Rolandos. The Rolandos are moved by rolling left or right on the screen by tilting the iPhone or iPod touch. Players manipulate the environments by touching the screen. Yellow objects are moveable and the player must configure the scene to solve puzzles and create paths through which the Rolandos roll to safety.

The Rolandos worship the player as a diety, referring to "the Finger" and pleading to it for help. The story of the game takes place over four worlds of Rolandoland. Each world has a unique art style and different game mechanics, including bombs, fans, levers, pulley systems, pushable debris, light beams, "drawn paths" (dynamic surfaces drawn by touching and dragging on the screen) and motorized platforms. Rolando employs a two dimensional, cartoon-shaded vector art style and a pallete of strong primary hues.
title: Rolando

description:
An "endless" style game in the spirit of games like Tetris, but using light physics and quirky, off-beat humor. Features the likeness of Isaac Newton, and classical music remixed into an upbeat techno loop.

At its core the game uses the iPhone accelerometer to detect tilting of the screen, and uses this to alter the direction of gravity. The player uses this to direct falling apples onto Newton's exposed brain, scoring points and moving up "levels" for harder, fast-paced gameplay. This is complicated by the addition of hazards, power-ups, and general zaniness.

The game has both "Challenge" and "Endless" varieties. Challenges are different takes on the main game experience, with different objectives, hazards, and items than the endless mode.
title: Gravity Shmavity

description:
Tap Tap Revenge 2 is the sequel to the popular game Tap Tap Revenge on iTunes. The game is much like a Guitar Hero game, but for iPhone and iPod Touch. With 150 three tracks, there are three colored dots the player has to press as they pass the white line near the bottom of the screen. Also there are arrows indicating which way to shake the device. In more difficult sections, Tap & Hold and Multi-Tap techniques are required.

The game offers three main modes: one player, two players and online play. There is also a very easy option for kids to play. In the Challenge mode players can set a score and then e-mail another player for them to beat the score. Their progress is then shown on a bar. Players can also earn achievements stored in a career menu.
title: Tap Tap Revenge 2

description:
ABM Command (formerly DEFCON 1) is a missile defense game. The game is split into three phases:1. In the defense phase, ICBMs move from top to bottom of screen and player touches the screen to launch ABM interceptors. The player also rolls the screen side to side to scroll the battlefield.

  1. In the attack phase, the player turns the device to landscape mode and drags from the top to the bottom of the screen. ICBMs are launched at enemy cities in the location and direction that the player drags.

  2. Between rounds, the player can use money generated in the previous two phases to buy advanced special weapons. The weapons include standard missile command fare (MIRV, Smart Bomb, Bomber Wing) and special weapons unique to DEFCON 1 (Orbital Space Laser, Death Blossom, and offensive and defensive targeting systems).

Players can play as one of six fictional nations, each balanced in different categories (national population, technology base, economy, and regeneration rate). In the campaign game the player is attacked by each nation in turn (from easier to harder difficulty) until the player either defeats all enemies or is obliterated.
title: ABM Command: DEFense CONdition 1

description: A new rendition of the arcade classic, Centipede for the iPhone is tailored to the device's touch-screen and gaming capabilities. Included are three modes: Ultra, Arcade and Classic. Classic is the true original emulation adapted for the iPhone, Arcade offers totally new graphics and gameplay adjustments, while Ultra is an amped version with five new upgrades and four environmental power-ups. All modes feature a competitive 2-player option, scoring tables and the ability to play your own tunes while blasting away the buggies.
title: Centipede

description: Super Breakout is the enhanced version of the original Breakout game by Nolan Bushnell and Steve Bristow, which has spawned over the years a whole sub-genre of brick breaking variants. Upgraded for the iPhone, this official rendition of Super Breakout features the original Classic mode and a new Super mode (aka Super Super Breakout). The new mode has enhanced graphics, effects, sounds and gameplay adjustments to bring the classic game into the modern, portable era. Additional features for both modes include the ability to use any iTunes soundtrack and competitive 2-player action.
title: Super Breakout

description:
Black Sheep is a brain-teasing puzzle game where you have to help a black sheep escaping from the feed lot by placing modifiers such as direction change, jump or stop on the playground. White sheep can be used to be thrown into pits so that the black one can pass.

Most of the 40+ levels of the game feature multiple solutions. It is often important to think about timing when laying out the available modifiers so that white sheep are in place when the black one crosses their paths.

sample_screenshots.caption: White sheep can be used to fill gaps so that the black sheep can step over.
In some levels, the player has to guide the black sheep over concrete blocks to the exit.
White sheep can also be used to fill pits so that the black sheep can step over.

title: Black Sheep

description:
An illustrated hypertext adaptation of 1988's Choose Your Own Adventure gamebook #78, this adventure retains all 113 narrative sections of the original book, 18 of them a varied array of imaginative endings. The story concerns itself with a visit to an undersea realm by the narrator, with friend Horton James III in tow, to obtain proof of the existence of the kindly Atlanteans (originally aliens from the planet Agyr) and the rival Nodoors feuding with them.

Return to Atlantis is bundled with a supplementary gamebook adaptation of its precursor, 1979's Journey Under the Sea, the second Choose Your Own Adventure (and prolific CYOA author R. A. Montgomery's first!), containing an account of our intrepid explorer's Atlantean travels in the Seeker, a deep-sea submersible, setting the stage for its sequel. It contains 117 sections, 42 of which are different endings.
title: Return to Atlantis

description: Making of a Ninja is the first entry in the Cutout Heroes series. Nin, the lovable but inept ninja was given an ultimatum: either he beats the current shuriken range record or he will be banished from the village. Players have to play though nine increasingly difficult levels to try and beat the range, throwing four types of shuriken at nine different moving targets. The game also comes with bonuses (coloured targets provide bonus points and additional time) and penalties (black targets removes points and time).
title: Cutout Heroes: Making of a Ninja

description: Heat Shield is an atmospheric-entry simulator game for iPhone and iPod touch where you use tilt control to fly spacecraft. You can control the Apollo command modules, the Space Shuttle, the Spirit and Opportunity Mars rovers and more in missions to planets and moons in our solar system including Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Venus and Saturn's moon Titan. Heat Shield features a tutorial mission showing you the basic controls and an online leaderboard.
title: Heat Shield

description: Ten years down the line, this strategy game of demonic dominoes is remade with new, cuter graphics for a touch-screen (along the way, reducing its playfield from 12x12 to 8x8). The high and low is: nasty red demons have invaded the kingdom's suspiciously grid-like battlefield, and threaten to overwhelm its defenses as they randomly proliferate from round to round. The player is in charge of mustering the defenses (with nine different unit types to draw on, randomly dealt, making the most of their unique fire pattern) in such a fashion that in a given round they eliminate as many of the invaders as possible in grand chain reactions. If at the end of a round there remain more than 10 demons on the battlefield, the player has lost.
title: Diabolika

description:
Wooden Labyrinth 3D is an adaptation of the classic marble rolling game and designed for the iPhone's accelerometer. The player tilts the unit in order to control the direction and speed of the ball. Guide the ball from one end of the labyrinth to the exit hole but watch out for all the other holes in the way. Certain levels also allow the player to make the ball jump short obstacles by tapping the screen or bumping the bottom of the unit.

The game comes with 180 levels and also allows the user to create new labyrinths using an online editor.
title: Wooden Labyrinth 3D

description:
In StickWars, the player defends a fortress from invading hordes. In order to do this, the player uses the touch screen of the iPhone or iPod Touch to pick up invading stick figures and toss them high enough in the air so that they will die when they fall back to earth. Doing so rewards the player with cash which earns interest when it sits in the bank, or can be spent on fortress wall repairs, maintenance, or upgrades. The money can also purchase other things such as prisons which will hold invaders until such time that they decide to become part of your army.

As the game progresses, the player can train archers and wizards to more effectively repel invaders and build a variety of more effective counter-measures in a continuing arms race.
title: StickWars

description: Concrete Combat Racing is a car combat game in which the player selects from among a variety of cars -- both for himself and his opponent -- which will race around a large concrete parking lot while locked in a death struggle. The 7 cars available are rated for speed, weight, boost, and turning. On the course, the player's car and the computer-controlled car relentlessly pursue each other while firing bullets and missiles. The player controls his car by tilting the iPhone or iPod Touch in different directions in order to turn, while there are buttons for the gas pedal, brake pedal, and one button each for the offensive options.
title: Concrete Combat Racing

description:
Become a wiring expert with Cablink! Rotate each cable section and connect it up to the power source. As you connect each cable section to the power source, it will light up. When you're done, all the cables will be lit and the puzzle will be complete. Each puzzle has an ideal number of moves it can be completed in - aim for this set number of moves as your goal.

Cablink's difficulty can be customized to your liking with a variety of settings:* Twistier - makes the puzzle have more bends and path splits.

  • Blackout - hides the wires until they are connected up.
  • Hex Board - creates a hexagonal version of the board for a tougher challenge.
  • wrapping - wraps the cables around the board, making for an even trickier puzzle.

Cablink also allows you to generate codes for the puzzles you're playing, and share them with friends to challenge them. Who can get the best score?

sample_screenshots.caption: The blue dotted line indicates that the puzzle can wrap around to the other side
The big red and yellow dot is the power source - link all the cables to that
Just one more to go - that wasn't too hard
Hexagonal grids are more complex to solve...

title: Cablink

description:
How well do you know the alphabet? Alphabetic tests your skills as you find each letter in alphabetical order in a jumble of letters. While it starts off slowly, things quickly get more difficult as the letters shift, rotate and scale, making what should be a simple task quite difficult!

For each letter that you find, 3 seconds are added to the clock. Your aim is to reach Z before time runs out. Depending on how quickly you find the next letter, you may receive a score bonus. If you string together consecutive quick finds, you'll receive a chain bonus on top of that.

Alphabetic has a series of different modes, each one designed to test your skill, including: Quick Game:* See how quickly you can make it from A to Z.

  • Reverse: start with Z and work your way back to A.
  • Endless: after Z, you start back at A. How long can you last?
  • Double: find each letter twice.
  • Numeric: search for numbers instead of letters.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finish Quick Game, and Challenges unlock

title: Alphabetic

description:
Theseus is an electronic conversion of the Theseus and the Minotaur pencil-and-paper maze puzzle by Robert Abbott, based on the concept of logic mazes where certain limitations in movement apply.

The game consists of 85 mazes with an increasing difficulty to solve, designed by the original author, one of the early converters Toby Nelson, as well as Claude-Guy Quimper. Players need to guide Theseus (represented by a blue ball) towards the exit of the maze, while avoiding the minotaur (represented by a horned, red ball). The goal of each level is to reach the exit, but this cannot be done by travelling towards it directly. Theseus is only able to move one tile at at time, while the minotaur can do two. To reach the exit, Theseus has to outsmart the minotaur by luring him into a specific position, exploiting the internal movement logic. The minotaur will not chase after Theseus directly, but approaches him based on rules of vertical and horizontal movement. For instance, when Theseus is on the same horizontal line as the minotaur, but with a wall between them, he is able to move left and right as much as he wants without having the minotaur move. At certain moments it is also needed to delay an action or skip the turn, to lure the minotaur into a certain path without moving Theseus.

The game is entirely controlled through the touch screen and includes an automatic save function, an undo and reset button, and different hints. The game also keeps track of the amount of moves that was needed to solve the puzzle and provides an award based on the result.
title: Theseus

description:
Squibs Arcade is a collection of games inspired by contemporary video games, distilling the game play to its most fundamental form, and re-imagining them with the style of the classic LCD games. There are seven games in total, each with its own gameplay mechanics, and all homages and parodies of the games which inspired them.

In Crowd Wader, for example, the player needs to step left and right trying to avoid a hail of pedestrians crossing his path, while progressing to steal a merchant's purse and return home with it.

Fantasy Turn Base comes in two parts. The first is an arbitrary walk through the forest which ends only when meeting a monster. Then follows a twitch response game where the monster's fiery breath need to be blocked.

Cardboard Axel Mush is a sneak-em-up in a cardboard box. Sneak past the guards by carefully timing movement left and right – if they turn around, and the character is not in a position hidden by a box, they will spot him! This, like the others, uses similar movements controls (left/right/fire) as per the old LCD games which moves the player (and enemies and missiles) into one of several discrete positions.

In We're Fat Shigeru needs to avoid the cakes and eat carrots to stay healthy, in Gun Cogs the player needs to collect cogs while avoid getting shot, Regret the Fist is about dodging enemy attacks and Call of Honour is a shooting game set inside a maze.

All games are presented in the traditional LCD way with original stickers, scratches and all.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cardboard (i.e. not metal), Axel (i.e. not gear), Mush (i.e. not solid)
Crowd Wader (<moby game="Assassin's Creed">Assassin's Creed</moby>, anyone?)
Gun cogs (parody of <moby game="Gears of War">Gears of War</moby>)

title: Squibs Arcade

description: EyePhonespy Dogs takes inspiration from the fun style of books and lists from the 70s and 80s in which children and adults were encouraged to look around them and actively seek out the many wonders of the world. The game contains a list of 50 dogs which players need to tick off when they see them, in the real world, to score points. Each item contains a picture of the dog, plus basic and detailed information about them, to educate. Up to four players can store a separate list in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: More detailed information about the dog

title: EyePhonespy Dogs

description:
In Lifeboat the player attempts to save as many passengers as they can by tilting their iPhone or iPod Touch from side to side. The game is a 3D perspective, physics based title, and tilting the phone rocks the boat, thus tipping the passengers in that direction.

Throughout the game lifeboats appear around the ship and each lifeboat leaves after a set amount of time, or when it is filled with 5 passengers. If passengers fall into the water, the player may tap on them to save them, and if they don't they can drown or get eaten by a shark or crocodile depending on the level.

The game has a Quick Play which is a simple timed run, and a campaign where the player plays through 7 increasingly difficult levels.
title: Lifeboat

description: Cubit is a 3D puzzle game where the player must arrange cubes into proper configurations, as seen from the front, top, and side perspectives. Each perspective has a grid of cells, which could be blank, or contain a number from 1 through 4. The player's goal is to arrange the cubes so that any numbered cell borders an equal number of cubes, when viewed from that cell's perspective. The game has 100 levels of increasing complexity, and contains Twitter integration, allowing players who have beaten a level to post that fact online.
title: Cubit

description: Germ-inator is a puzzle game in the style of "Where's Waldo?", in which a player must reveal and select the correct germ out of a crowd within a given time limit. A variety of additional gameplay modes are provided, including some that make use of the iPhone's accelerometer.
title: Germ-inator

description:
Set in the Mass Effect universe, Mass Effect Galaxy describes an episode in the perilous life of a new human ally in the then upcoming Mass Effect 2, Jacob Taylor, a biotic-powered super-soldier, along with Miranda, an Alliance spy. Jacob tries to prevent a heinous attack on civilization's greatest beacon of hope, the mighty Citadel space station, which was planned to knock humanity off the galactic stage. The game is composed of two parts: top-down arcade-style combat and multiple choice conversations.

The Combat part includes using the accelerometer to move the character, tapping enemies on screens to lock aim of the assault rifle on them and to auto-fire until the target is dead, and selecting one of three biotic powers available such as stasis to freeze enemies, heavy weapon rocket launcher to launch rockets, and tech talent overload to shut down enemy shields.

The Conversation part allows the player to see characters in comics-style third-person view, to hear their voices, to choose a topic, and to follow the path of paragon or renegade to progress in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The leader of the pirates is open for talks.
Used one of my biotic abilities on that enemy.
That guy is very sick and I have the cure - perfect situation for an interrogation.
My epic return to the Citadel.

title: Mass Effect: Galaxy

description: A remake of the Atari's 80's arcade classic for Apple's iPhone and iPod Touch. The original defend-the-cities game now has both an Ultra and Classic mode. The Ultra mode takes the established game of shooting attacking UFOs out of the sky with the player's missiles from ground bases and adds multipliers, boss UFOs, and updated graphics. The Classic mode sports an authentic remake of the classic for the touch screen. The iPhone's touch screen adds multi-touch gameplay.
title: Missile Command

description: Perfect Balance: Harmony is a casual physics puzzle game where the player must stack the given shapes onto the static level geometry so that they don't fall off the screen. Some of the shapes are Tetris-like, some more complex. The game contains 100 levels, and a secret bonus mode where the player can also add max 9 extra, round diamonds on top of the other shapes. The game is based on three previously released flash Perfect Balance games from the same author.
title: Perfect Balance: Harmony

description: Perfect Balance: Inferno is the second Perfect Balance physics puzzle game for iPhone & iPod Touch devices. The game is about balancing different kinds of shapes (Tetris-like, more complex, balls, heavy weights, ...) on static level geometry and this time also on rotating saw blades and platforms so that the shapes don't fall off the screen. Latter levels introduce winter mode where friction is minimal. The game contains 120 levels and also the same bonus mode as Perfect Balance: Harmony, only this time you can add round and rectangular extra shapes to your construction.
title: Perfect Balance: Inferno

description: iDrop Dead is a ragdoll game where the player must throw around the ragdolls and cause as much damage to them as possible. The ragdolls break into pieces, there are bombs of different kind, fire, saw blades, piles of boxes, and the game is pretty bloody as well. The game contains four game modes (normal, time attack, 1 pull and freeplay) with different rules and level goals. The more the player scores the more worlds, characters, extra pulls and hidden features he is able to unlock. This title is a direct sequel to the Drop Dead flash-based browser games.
title: iDrop Dead

description:
Bananagrams is a Scrabble-like multiplayer game based on the physical game Bananagrams. The iPhone version allows both single player gameplay, as well as online multiplayer which more closely matches the real world experience.

Each player has their own set of tiles to work with and must build their own word tree, using crossword/Scrabble rules. Once all of a player's current tiles are in a word tree they peel, and each player must draw another tile from the shared bunch of remaining tiles. Play continues until all tiles in the bunch are gone, and at that point the first player to get all of their tiles into words wins by calling Bananas.

The iPhone version also links to the players playing on Facebook and allows earning of rewards and new tiles or game boards.
title: Bananagrams

description:
Hi, How Are You is a game featuring the artwork and music of the independent artist and singer songwriter Daniel Johnston. In his psychedelic universe of good and evil, Satan turns the player's character Jeremiah into a frog, known from the drawing titled Hi, How Are You and popularized into the mainstream by late Nirvana member Kurt Cobain who wore it on a T-shirt during quite some of his shows.

The player needs to guide Jeremiah through twenty-five levels to reverse the curse and rescue a girl, using tilt controls or using the on screen joystick controls. The brightly coloured, cel shaded levels are filled with obstacles, platforms and enemies. To complete a level, all squares on the floor need to lighted. This is done by moving over them, but passing twice disables them again. This earns the player a bronze medal, but silver and gold are also available for an extra challenge. To reach silver, all normal blocks need to be lighted, as well as the hard-to-reach challenge blocks. For gold, the same needs to be done, but in a strict time limit.

The game is in full 3D, with a camera that can rotate in a 360-degrees angle. Tapping the screen makes Jeremiah jump and there are also a number of springs that automate the process. There are four characters available (unlocked progressively). Players can also make available twenty pieces of Johnston's art by unlocking achievements. The music is of course all based on tracks by the artist.
title: Hi, How Are You

description: Wordular is a puzzle game based on words. Letters are displayed in a circle and players have to make words against the clock. Each level has a time limit and a specific number of words that needs to be found. There is also a limited number of swaps, meaning the player can choose a letter from the circle and have another one instead. New swaps can be earned by finding the secret word in each level. The game contains a database of over 150,000 words, a high scores table and progress is saved automatically.
title: Wordular

description:
Avoid Hitting Piano is a very fast side-scrolling game where the player is Ludwig van Beethoven in Vienna, 1826. He is late to deliver the musical score for his latest string quartet, opus 131 in c sharp minor, and now has to get it to the destination quickly.

Players control different characters, one at a time, as they run through the scenery, tapping the screen anywhere to jump over objects or characters that pass by. When one of them accidentally hits one, the game is not over right away, but a second chance is given by synchronizing the word "Beethoven" over the word "piano" multiple times, in a very different environment.

The game also tries to confuse the player by quickly skipping to different segments at different speeds, often changing the protagonist as well as the colours in the environment.
title: Avoid Hitting Piano

description:
Enemy of Chaos is a satirical fantasy/sci-fi gamebook simultaneously released both in conventional print form and as an iPhone / iPod Touch app. The player controls the actions of an aging, mildly autistic nerd in a humourously exaggerated version of the real world, navigating around and overcoming such obstacles as traffic jams and the vagaries of the postal system while uncovering a sinister conspiracy at the heart of Madame Tussaud's empire of wax statuary. The game opens with the protagonist answering the call to employment they'd been awaiting all this time: "Person with superior reasoning ability required."

While book readers have to hunt for numbered paragraph references like backwards primitives, in the mobile electronic version of the gamebook plot fork selections are picked from a list by touching them. In the app version of the gamebook additional material that didn't make it into the print run can be read and enjoyed, and the program also automates die-rolling and tracking of the character's vital statistics (WPM, IQ, BMI and OCD score on top of the conventional SKILL, STAMINA and LUCK).
title: Enemy of Chaos

description:
Gravity Sling is an inertia based puzzle game where the player uses their finger to set the initial velocity and direction of the astronaut. The goal is to launch the astronaut back to the space shuttle by taking the longest path possible.

The game was created in a single day at the iPhone Game Jam and the first fifteen levels are available for free. Players are able to buy a pack of 30 additional levels from within the application. Global leaderboards and achievements are supported as well.
title: Gravity Sling

description: Episode-1 is the prologue to the Fallen survival horror series, modelled after Resident Evil and Silent Hill. The players guide Roman Mendez, a jailbird, through his escape from the penitentiary where he is shut. But the prison is strangely empty: the criminals are gone and everywhere there are mysterious creatures. Roman has to face these monsters to discover what has happened. The game is in 2.5D, with more than 10 special interactions (mini-games) to win and more than 40 locations to explore. Roman can move around, have conversations, and items are stored in an inventory.
title: Fallen EP-1

description:
Grow an assortment of flowers in pots on a windowsill with the game Green Fingers. Use the touch screen to shuffle around pots so that they get the sun, rain and fertilizer, and you'll soon have plenty of flowers blooming in no time. But watch out - if you put the wrong item in the wrong pot - it's game over!

Green Fingers is an action game where you must react quickly to the ingredients given to put in a series of flowerpots, then shuffle them around on the shelf accordingly. Once a pot receives fertilizer, you must move it to a seed bag so that a seed is planted and you can begin to make it grow. Early seeds only need one ingredient, but later on, seeds can require multiple ingredients to get the flower to grow. Blooming multiple flowers in a row earns you bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: If you grow a whole heap of flowers in a row, you'll score a bonus
Tap an object to make it fall faster
It can get tricky when multiple objects begin to fall

title: Green Fingers

description:
Explore deep caves to find sacred idols and loot treasure - but watch out for the terrifying monsters, bats, traps and lava pits, all intending to spell doom for you! Can you use your trusty grappling hook to swing to safety and escape each perilous pit?

Hook Champ plays like a simplified version of the NES game Bionic Commando. If the player touches and holds the lower half of the screen, the character will run, while if they touch and hold the upper half of the screen, the character will throw out their grappling hook. While the player can run along the ground to progress, it is much quicker to continuously chain grappling swings, and considering you're being constantly chased by a monster, eager to gobble you up, you'll want to keep moving as fast as possible!

As you progress through the game, you'll earn coins. These can be used to purchase better grapples, running shoes, a jetpack, a shotgun, or fabulous hats. And everybody loves hats.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the game's darker levels
Upgrades can be used throughout the game
The player is chased by various monsters
Purchasing items from the shop, including snazzy hats!

title: Hook Champ

description:
The year is 2145. Sometime in June, at approximately 21:00 hours UMT, something went very wrong on Mars. At the Delta Labs of the UAC Research Facility located in Mars City, an experiment triggered an unknown event, resulting in the invasion of the entire facility. Marine forces have been deployed to hot spots everywhere. Bravo Team was sent to the EnPro facility but was ambushed while searching for survivors. One of the first tasks for the players of DOOM³ was to locate said Bravo Team. One thing was not known at that time: not the entire team was killed during the ambush. One other lone marine survived the attack and managed to make his way to the final evacuation ship. In DOOM Resurrection, the player now follows the story of this marine.

The game is a so-called rail-shooter. Looking through the eyes of the marine, the player automatically moves through the levels on a pre-determined path with scripts triggering every enemy spawn and cutscene. The player's only task is to aim, shoot and dodge incoming fire. To fend off the already known enemies ranging from zombies over dead soldiers to full-grown hellknights, the player has access to up to three weapons at the same time. The assault rifle is the default one with unlimited ammo. All other weapons require ammunition that can found everywhere in the levels and is collected by simply touching the screen at that location. Health kits can be collected in a similar manner. The other weapons include the normal and double-barrel-shotgun, the Gatling gun and the BFG, which are found at pre-determined points during the game.

The marine is not completely alone on his journey. While a helpful scientist will keep in contact most of the time, a flying robot called Sam follows the player around, opening doors and providing the link to the scientist. If the player is tired of escaping the research facility, he can try and beat one of the available challenges, among which are killing a hellknight without receiving any damage and with 100% accuracy or finishing a section of the game in only one minute.

sample_screenshots.caption: Imp and Hellknight fireballs need to be dodged at the right moments.
And boom make the grenades. This explosion is the reason you don't have any in this game.
If a fat zombie gets a hold of you, you've to shake your device to get free.
Zombies everywhere - as we already know.

title: Doom Resurrection

description:
Finger Physics is a physics-based puzzle game. The over 100 available levels are divided into several stages of difficulty and game-modes including: Egg mode* - The player has to get the egg into the basked by destroying (tapping) the glass blocks in the right order.

  • Lawn mode - The player has to build a construction that is stable for at least five seconds using all the available blocks.

  • Lunar mode - The player has to build a construction that is stable for at least five seconds using all the available blocks and reach at least the bronze stripe at the top of the level by doing so.

  • Underwater mode - Again the player has to build a construction that is stable for at least five seconds using all the available blocks. But this time the blocks automatically float either to the top (light blue) or bottom (light green).

  • Free mode - The player has to build a construction that is stable for at least five seconds using the maximum amount of blocks in a given time.

To spice things up, special blocks drop in all the game modes with different attributes like the blue and red magnetic blocks that either cling to each other or repel themselves. Or the orange blocks which explode if put together.

sample_screenshots.caption: I guess that's not a stable structure - Game Over in a few seconds when the block on the right goes out of the screen.
Oh no the egg will go over the container!
Another build a stable structure level - still fairly easy to solve.
Another simple looking but hard egg-puzzle.
You've to get the red egg down into the container on bottom right.

title: Finger Physics

description:
Tap Tap Revenge: Metallica is a Tap Tap Revenge 3-version focusing on the famous metal-band Metallica featuring ten songs spread over their whole discography including "Enter Sandman" and "Master of Puppets".

The gameplay remains exactly the same as in the original game. Balls come rolling down a screen in the beat of the music and the player has to hit them at the correct time when they reach the bottom in order to score points. If he keeps hitting the balls correctly, his multiplier will go up until it reaches a maximum of 8x which is activated by shaking the device. In addition special balls come down the ramp which unlock access to power-ups if all hit correctly like a temporary 16x-multiplier.

The game features four difficulty modes ranging from easy to extreme. Hard and extreme are played in landscape-mode and feature four and five lanes instead of the normal three. Also available are four unlockable boss tracks and a battle mode either against the computer or over bluetooth against another player which features various kinds of weapons that obstruct the view for a few seconds.

sample_screenshots.caption: 88% accuracy - not bad for that shitty song.
The shield-power-up slows the balls down.
Special balls incoming. Play them correctly for a power-up.

title: Tap Tap Revenge: Metallica

description: In this game you take control of a giant snowball, using the accelerometers. You will have to protect Santa's gifts from eskimos, old ladies, woodsmen and penguins by rolling over them while avoiding their attacks. This is a survival game, so the objective is to defend the gifts for as long as possible. The game also has online leaderboards through Openfeint.
title: Snowball Smash

description:
This version of SimCity is a handheld-port of SimCity 3000. The graphics as well as the overall gameplay-mechanics remain the same as in the original game. The player takes on the role of a mayor and has to build up the ultimate city from scratch. To do so he builds infrastructure like roads and water-pipes, declares building zones and places public buildings where needed always having an eye both on the immigration-rate and the cities finances. Consultants and statistics are there to help the player find the current problem-areas in the city.

As opposed to the original game, the maps in the handheld-version are smaller but on the other hand the building-slots can now hold much more inhabitants making up for the difference. The controls have also been changed to be able to build the city with a touch-screen. The main difference being that something the player builds won't immediately show up on the map. Instead he can make changes to the placement like increasing the length of the road or move it around a bit before giving the final order to build. In addition the way water and electricity work has been changed a bit. In the original each house needed a connection to the pipes and pylons as long as no other house near it had one. Now the connections automatically supply a certain area around them weather or not a house has been build directly on it similar to the way roads work.

sample_screenshots.caption: As opposed to the original game, stuff you build doesn't show up immediately in order for the player to be able to correct things.
My new city already has 46 inhabitants!
Now that's what I call a city - although it only has around 235.000 inhabitants.
That's what the perfect water-pipe-infrastructure looks like.

title: SimCity

description:
This version of Paperboy is a remake of the original Atari game of the same name. The player still takes on the role of the paperboy who has to deliver papers to his customers while inflicting as much damage as possible to the houses of his non-customers. To make things more difficult, numerous obstacles get in his way including construction workers, rogue tires, skateboarders, dogs and cats and more. If the player hits one of these he immediately looses one life. If all lives have been lost or the player has lost all his customers by not delivering a paper or destroying their property, the game ends. Additional lives are added when the player earns enough points. Points are earned depending on where the newspaper lands. If the player hits the mailbox of a customer, he gets more points than hitting the doormat. Houses of non-customers on the other hand give points when windows break or the player drives over the priceless flowers in the yard. At the end of each day, a training course awaits for additional points.

New in this version are the enhanced graphics in the classic isometric view and the optional 3D-view as well as three new game-modes. Besides the classic-mode where everything plays exactly as the original, there's the somewhat easier casual-mode. Here points and such can also be earned by collecting cards scattered on the ground. The other modes are time-attack, finish the day as fast as possible, and the challenge-mode where the player has to fulfill certain objectives during his workday.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yes, a replay of the training course. I hit that wall in front...
I just fucked up a delivery as you can see by the broken window.

title: Paperboy

description:
FaceFighter is a boxing game that allow players to face off against friends, enemies, pets, or even cartoon characters. Anything with a face can be photographed and imported into the game for use as a boxing opponent.

Players have four basic fighting moves at their disposal: jab, punch, kick and block. By making different combinations, players can K.O. their opponent. By landing blows successfully, players fill up a "rage" meter to unleash Legendary Fury, a special attack that gives the player a time-limited weapon, such as a wrench, frying pan, or rubber chicken.

The game is over when either the player or the opponent is knocked out three times. The game features single player and Bluetooth-enabled multiplayer.
title: FaceFighter

description:
In Zombie Pizza, you play as a new apprentice to Pizza Chef Zomboni, who has been bitten by zombies and will soon become one of the walking dead.

In this horror-themed puzzle game, players race to combine ingredients such as eyeballs, hearts, bones, guts, and brains into grotesque Zombie Pizzas: The Roadkill, The Split Dog, The Gut Buster, and the Stink Eye.

To make these pizzas, players must sort ingredients from the fast-moving conveyor-belt and place them onto blank pizzas, and then flick completed pizzas through the slot to feed the zombies.

Players can serve up high-value, Special Order recipes to rack up dollars, earn gold medals, and advance through the Zombie Pizza ranks from Trainee to Owner. But if the pizzas are made incorrectly or too slowly, the Zombie Rage meter will overload and the undead smash through the door, ending the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Players will receive 'special order' recipes for bonus points. But watch the 'rage meter' -- the red bar on upper left -- if it fills up, zombies will break down the door and put you on the menu.

Zombie Pizza ingredients drop down from the pipe at left, then run down a conveyor belt. You arrange them according 'recipe' and the flip completed pizzas through the slot to feed the ravenous undead.

title: Zombie Pizza

description: HyperBowl Rome is the second lane of the HyperBowl series, featuring a a 3D scene of ancient Rome with columns and aquaducts. The scoring is that of a standard ten-pin bowling game. The bowling ball is pushed by repeatedly swiping the screen - it can be rolled forward or backwards, left or right. The ball gutters if you roll or fall off the "lane". Vases can be knocked over and colliding with the animated flowers will propel the ball upwards.
title: HyperBowl Rome

description:
A mysterious thief has started showing up in town, snagging treasure as he grapples through the air, silhouette against the full moon. He uses the things he steals to help townsfolk and solve problems. The citizens have given him a nickname - the Moon Dancer.

Created by Gen Suzuki, maker of Ninja Five-O, Grappling Action: Moon Dancer is a side-scrolling platformer that is played with the iPhone's accelerometer and touch screen. The player moves Moon Dancer by tilting the device left or right, and throws out his grapple by tapping the screen where you want the grapple to end. As with Bionic Commando, Moon Dancer cannot jump and thus must use his grapple to traverse through all terrain. The grapple can also be used to snag far-off objects while Moon Dancer is flying through the air - he also gains bonus multipliers for every moon coin he grabs without touching the ground (up to a maximum of x8).

Depending on the level, Moon Dancer must either find one or more objects and either give them to people, or use them (such as a key to unlock a door). By swiping the bottom of the screen from left to right, the inventory is displayed, allowing Moon Dancer to use items. The other goal a level may have is to reach the exit - in this kind of level, it's up to Moon Dancer to find the exit, which is marked by a large arrow that points him in the right direction.

sample_screenshots.caption: As you gain momentum, you swing round more
You can snag the coins by tapping them

title: Grappling Action: Moon Dancer

description:
Play an enhanced remix of the classic, Pac-Man! Experience the classic fun of Pac-Man, with new features that change up the gameplay, making it more exciting than ever before.

Pac-Man Remix is an iPhone port of Pac-Man Arrangement from the PSP's Namco Museum Battle Collection. The basic game is the same as the classic Pac-Man, in that your goal is to eat all the pellets in the maze while avoiding the ghosts. However, there are new power ups such as the Dash Boots (which allow Pac-Man to run), and the Jump Feather (which lets Pac-Man hop over enemies and even walls!). There are also bonus items in addition to the classic Power Pellet - the Splitting Scroll, which allows Pac-Man to split up into multiple versions of himself which ghosts cannot touch, and a Lucky Present, which turns all remaining pellets into Power Pellets.

There are now more obstacles in the mazes to make things trickier for Pac-Man. Warp Panels teleport Pac-Man to other areas in the maze, Dash Panels allow Pac-Man to briefly run in the direction of the arrow, Tunnels let Pac-Man hide from view, Doors and Bridges prevent Pac-Man from crossing, and Elevators allow Pac-Man to travel to different levels in the maze.
title: Pac-Man Remix

description:
Play an enhanced remix of the classic, Dig Dug! Experience the classic fun of Dig Dug, with new features that change up the gameplay, making it more exciting than ever before.

Dig Dug Remix is an iPhone port of Dig Dug Arrangement from the PSP's Namco Museum Battle Collection. The basic game is the same as the original, in that your goal is to dig through the earth's crust, and pump up all of the nasty enemies underneath until they pop, to progress to the next stage. However, new elements such as hazards and items have been added to change the core game.

As Dig Dug progresses through the various worlds, he'll encounter new items and hazards. Pipes allow him to travel from one end and pop out the other side, Hard Layers take longer to dig through, Solid Layers are impassible with his normal drill, Geysers blow out water either vertically or horizontally at regular intervals, and Lava is intensely hot and will instantly kill Dig Dug if touched.

Luckily, new items have been added to help Dig Dug with these new obstacles. The Enhanced Shovel temporarily allows you to dig faster, the Drill not only allows you to dig faster but also also enables you to dig through Solid Layers, and the Boots let Dig Dug move faster through the levels.

The original Dig Dug is also included.
title: Dig Dug Remix

description:
Play an enhanced remix of the classic, Galaga! Experience the classic fun of Galaga, with new features that change up the gameplay, making it more exciting than ever before.

Galaga Remix is an iPhone port of Galaga Arrangement from the PSP's Namco Museum Battle Collection. The basic game is the same as the original - players must destroy all fighters on-screen to progress to the next round.

However, while the original game had one ship with a tractor beam that would kidnap your own (which could then be rescued and allow for double firepower), Galaga Remix has three different ships with tractor beams (A, B and C), allowing the player to create up to nine unique power-ups:

  • Wide Shot (A)
  • Rapid Fire (B)
  • Scattershot (C)
  • Wide Shot 2 (AA)
  • Laser (BB)
  • Scattershot 2 (CC)
  • Wide Rapid (AB)
  • Wide Scatter (AC)
  • Rapid Scatter (BC)

The original Galaga is also included.
title: Galaga: Remix

description: HyperBowl Forest is the third lane of the HyperBowl series, taking place in a forest with trees and running rooks. The scoring is that of a standard ten-pin bowling game. The bowling ball is pushed by repeatedly swiping the screen - it can be rolled forward or backwards, left or right. The ball gutters if you roll into a brook. The curved bases of the tree trunks allow a slingshot effect as you roll.
title: HyperBowl Forest

description:
In Bird Strike the player indirectly controls a bird in order to get the highest score in the different levels. To do so, the player flings the bird up in the air via touch-screen at the beginning of a level and then has to move the device around in order to alter the flight-path of the little birdie. But the initial fling won't push the bird very far up so in order to get higher and higher, the bird has to hit rockets or enter an air-stream to get further up. Once the bird reaches the top of the level, an UFO infuses him with energy and he falls down the whole level, destroying everything in his path until he hits the ground and the level ends.

Several obstacles hinder the birds fly upwards including steam-beams, balloons and other birds. Most of these obstacles are normally indestructible on the players way up and have to be avoided at all costs or the bird will stop his ascent and fly down until he hits another rocket or is back on the ground. Power-ups scattered around the level including a helmet which allows the bird to destroy objects even on his way up and an umbrella which slows down his descent help the player to get the highest score possible. In order to score points, the bird on the other hand needs to collect seeds and destroy as many objects as possible. Bonus points are earned if the player hits the sewer entrance on his way down or performs a really high climb with just one rocket.

sample_screenshots.caption: The wind on the left will carry me even higher - unless I hit the steel beams first.
At the end the bird hits the ground hard.
The umbrella allows for a slower descent - at least for a limited time.
Won a silver medal and unlocked a new level.

title: Bird Strike

description:
In Lemming Rampage, the player uses a catapult to throw lemmings into the air. By using objects such as trampolines, jetpacks and accelerator pads, the lemming proceeds through the levels. The game has 7 stages that are subsequently unlocked by reaching given meters in one of the levels of the previous stage.

In some levels lemmings can die when touching spikes or falling through the ground. When a lemming dies, the player can send it to the Lemming Heaven, which is the online highscore list. Therefore, players from all over the world compete with each other.

The controls of the game make heavy use of the accelerometer of the iPhone in order to control a lemming's behavior in the air. A so-called timeshift mode allows the player to stop time whenever it is necessary and to rewind out of dangerous situations.

Players get medals for reaching certain meters in the levels: bronze, silver and gold. Bronze unlocks the next stage of levels and silver unlocks a new lemming skin. The gold medal unlocks a so-called menu achievement that lets the menus of the game grow by adding new eye-candy items and nice gimmicks. There is a hidden Night Mode than can be enabled which gives the player three additional master levels.
title: Lemming Rampage

description:
A drawing game for the iPhone where up to 5 players in a match take turns drawing and guessing for points.

Each game has five rounds lasting 30 seconds each. One player each round will be assigned a random object to draw on the touch screen; they have a simple palette of colors to choose from. The other players are given up to six possible answers to choose from. Players receive 1 point for a correct answer and an additional point for every player they beat to the answer. The drawer receives 1 point for drawing plus the combined points of every player who answered correctly.

Players can play with friends or be paired with random strangers. A "Lightning Round" mode where the player only guesses is available for an additional fee; a similar guessing-only mode is also available when there are no currently-running matches available for the player to enter.

sample_screenshots.caption: A simple drawing, but it gets the job done

title: Depict

description:
Penguin Angel is a casual game for the iPhone. In the game, penguins have escaped from the London Zoo and are wandering the city streets, while at the same time - in a nod to Charles Fort's work on historical anomalies - strange objects are raining from the sky. The player takes control of the penguins' guardian angel, who protects them by pushing away falling objects before they hit the penguins. There are 3 levels of difficulty and 19 stages to complete.

The game uses the device's accelerometer as the control input. Players tilt the device up, down, left and right to control a guardian angel that flies above the penguins. The goal is to use the angel to push the falling objects away from the penguins. Each level is a timed stage, occurring in a different location in Victorian London. Players receive the "Perfect" badge if they complete a level without any of their penguins having been hit; this award carries over to later levels as long as no penguins are hit.

The game stands out because of its distinctive Victorian art style and quirky aesthetics. The art direction used original prints from the nineteenth century as the basis of the game art, from the characters to the backgrounds. The game levels progress through a series of street and city scenes, gradually leading to a cemetery in the final three levels. The falling objects also become increasingly menacing, with the bicycles and clocks of the early levels giving way to pianos, skeletal horses, and scimitars later on.

The game's idiosyncrasy comes through in other touches. The penguins, somewhat mysteriously, wear a variety of hats, sashes, and ties publicized in Victorian magazines. A peculiar comic figure, waving a wreath and a banner saying "Cheers!", pops down from the top of the screen after the player has pushed a certain number of objects away. The game's difficulty levels are not easy, medium, and hard, but rather "Easy-Peasy," Middling," and "Dreadful." The game also uses fonts typical of nineteenth-century publications.
title: Penguin Angel

description: Textropolis is a word-finding game where the player is presented with the names of various world cities and tasked with using the letters to create as many words of four or more letters as possible. Upon successfully entering a word the player is given the definition of said word. As various benchmark numbers of words are reached for each level the background graphics change and eventually the next level is unlocked. Hints are available to the player, but these will lower their score.

sample_screenshots.caption: The plane flies by with a definition
Entering a word, as the system displays what you've already entered

title: Textropolis

description:
Dungeon Solitaire is an original fantasy card game. Monsters are flooding up through the Castle Wolfcairn's tunnels after a prison break went bad.

Players must carefully place heroes, monsters, items, treasures, and trap cards into the dungeon chambers. When a hero and monster face each other, a battle ensues and the strongest will survive. Players win the game by filling up the castle dungeon with heroes, and lose the game if the dungeons are filled by monsters, who will slowly start to destroy the castle.

The game features themed downloadable expansion packs that adds new monsters, heroes, and special abilities. Dungeon Solitaire also includes online leaderboards and achievements.
title: Dungeon Solitaire

description:
Earth Vs Moon is an arcade shooter game that combines elements from Missile Command, Space Invaders and Galaxian.

In this game it is up to the player to defend the earth from the invading moon. This is done in traditional Missile Command style with three missile installations that can fire projectiles to destroy incoming bombs. The player determines where to fire by tapping on the screen.
