The missiles take a while to arrive, thus the player has to predict where the incoming bombs will be at the time of explosion.

Each bomb that reaches the Earth scorches part of its surface. The player is game over if the entire earth is scorched. But after each level the Earth resets again.

Aside from falling bombs also Space Invader-like alien ships will descend towards the earth in their typical zigzag pattern. Destroying one of them with your missiles often causes a chain reaction taking out quite a lot of them.

There are various boss levels in the game as well. In these levels other arcade games are mimicked such as Pong and Breakout.

The simple story is told through newspaper articles.

Aside from the story mode the game also features Boss Attack and Score Attack. The first is a time attack for all the boss levels. In the second the player has to get as much points as possible in a randomly generated level.
title: Earth Vs Moon

description:
Mike V: Do or Die - Skateboarding is a skateboarding game built around Mike Vallely. Players start in the ‘Bones Brigade’ Powell & Peralta era and moves through the different stages of his career. It is possible to improve skills while gaining experience to unlock additional content. The character, board, wheels and ride can be customized with different items. The game contains over 40 tricks, licensed brands, 7 skate locations and an open city driving mode.

Players control the skater by pushing the left side of the screen to gain speed. On the right side a skateboard is shown and by pressing certain areas with the right thumb, tricks can be performed.
title: Mike V: Do or Die

description:
Celebrating one of our rarer extreme sports, this game simulates the rough-and-tumble passtime of tall bike jousting, where fabricators of bicycles of unusual height attempt to knock each other off of their precarious and barely-welded-together steeds, generally after the consumption of copious quantities of alcoholic beverages. After selecting a game mode (single-bout or inter-city tournament) a player is presented with the driver's seat view from atop a rickety tall bike; pedaling is simulated by stroking the sides of the screen to get up to speed, and the "lance" (generally padded bamboo or PVC piping) is targeted by tapping the approaching tattooed opponent (but not on their head, one of the sports' few rules.) The game does some calculations behind the scenes following the critical moment of encounter and then employs ragdoll physics to display the outcome of the match in slow-motion.

There is an RPG element where successful players get to develop various stats which assist in retaining control of their vehicle; also, the player's tall bike may be upgraded (or repaired following damaging dismounts) between bouts. The world circuit transports the player to such exotic cycling climes as Brooklyn, Minneapolis, Reno, New Orleans, Hong Kong and Amsterdam, and eventually they may find themselves up against World Tall Bike Joust Champion Ryan Doyle, part of the real-world Black Label freak bike mechanic crew and subject of Fountainhead Films' 2007 documentary B.I.K.E. which this game ties in to.
title: Tall Bike Joust

description:
The Talon's are a technologically advanced race that wants to strip Earth for it resources. Of course Earth has a problem with that. In 2248 Commander Ethan Avery is sent to Infinity Station to investigate the loss of contact with the Top Secret research facility. Soon it becomes clear that Talon's have invaded the station and are looking for the mysteries behind Infinity Project - whatever it may be.

The Infinity Project is a first-person-shooter in which the player takes over the control of Ethan Avery, exploring the station and fighting the various types of Talon's trying to stop him. Included are several tough bosses, who can take quite a beating before going down. During the course of the game the player will find several different kinds of weapons to help him in his quest ranging from a pistol with unlimited ammo, over silenced machine guns to powerful laser rifles and rocket launchers. Also available are grenades.

As in most modern shooters, the players health regenerates automatically if not fired upon for a few seconds. Most of the game consists of fighting enemies, finding the security card in a level and unlock with it the door to the next stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: I think something is about to explode.
That fighter thing is yours - but don't expect to fly home with it.
The other thing you'll be looking for most of the time: a security card.

title: The Infinity Project

description:
Eliminate Pro is an death match first person shooter. The game features multiple 3D arenas in which players can duke it out against other players online or against bots.

Controls are handled through the touch screen. On the left bottom of the screen is a virtual thumb stick which the player can control with his or her left thumb to move around. With his or her right thumb the player can look around. Tap the right thumb to shoot.

The game uses ngmoco:)'s "Freemium" business model. Everyone can download and play the game for free. Each day a player receives an amount of energy. This energy can be used to play online matches. Offline practice matches against bots don't cost energy. Once the energy is depleted the player can no longer play online that day unless he buys additional energy for real money.

Playing online matches earns the player credits. Credits can be used to improve the player's avatar. Weapons, appearance, shields, accuracy, speed, jumping and swimming can all be improved using credits.

The game keeps online rankings through the Plus+ framework.
title: Eliminate Pro

description:
Hello Kitty Parachute Paradise is an arcade game for the iPhone that makes use of the accelerometer.

Using the touch screen the player has to launch Hello Kitty into the air from the elastic band she's sitting on. The further the player pulls the further she'll go. But pull too far and the band will snap.

Once up in the air Hello Kitty will deploy a parachute and slowly glide down again. The player can control her direction by tilting the iPhone to the left or right. The goal is to collect apples and items which earn the player points. There are also prickly things that hurt Hello Kitty and thus cost the player points.

There are multiple levels with each a different background. All levels are randomized each time the player plays it. For each level there are online rankings. The player can opt to look at global rankings or local rankings. The game uses the iPhone's GPS function to determine the local position of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can decorate your room with the items you find.

title: Hello Kitty: Parachute Paradise

description:
Mafia Wars is an adaptation of the Browser game with the same name.

Most of the game play elements are more or less identical. Players still take on the role of a Mafia Don and perform jobs to earn money, items and experience. The player can fight other mafioso and create his or her own family by inviting other mafioso to join their mafia. The player can buy properties to earn additional income. Jobs and fights earn the player experience points. Earning enough points earns the player a level which allows him or her to assign additional points into his statistics.

The iPhone version has a simpler interface to compensate for the smaller screen and features less content (items, cities, etc.) than the Browser version.
title: Mafia Wars by Zynga

description:
Aurora Feint II: Arena Daemons is a persistent online multiplayer game featuring game play similar to Tetris Attack.

Players have a character that levels in a typical Role Playing Game style. Gaining experience is player by playing a Tetris Attack-like game. The game field is build up from runes and the player needs to line them up three (or more) of a kind to remove them and score points. Unlike Tetris Attack removed runes aren't immediately refilled from the top of the screen. Instead the screen slowly scrolls upward revealing more and more runes. The player can also tilt The screen to make the block fall to the left or right. The player can speed up by swiping the runes upwards.

Player vs Player battles can be performed in the arena but are asynchronous. Thus players don't fight against each other live. Instead a player challenges another player by fighting the AI and the other player has to beat that score.

Players can practice on their own in the single player areas of the game which is more or less the same as Aurora Feint: The Beginning. Players who already played the first part can import their character.

Players can chat with other online players in the tavern. Which can be accessed at any time by tapping the bottom of the screen.
title: Aurora Feint II: Arena Daemons

description: Ivory Tiles is a puzzle game. You tilt or touch the screen to move the tiles on the playing field. The goal is to move the tiles into the marked final position. As the game progresses, the puzzles become more complicated; they start to involve two levels. The tiles can fall to a lower level and possibly negating the chance of completing a puzzle thus making it more difficult. The ultimate goal is to solve the puzzle in the least amount of moves possible.
title: Ivory Tiles

description:
Map My Mind is a trivia puzzle game where the player progresses through differently themed maps (game boards) by answering questions and the goal is to end up on specific points on the map. These maps are made up out of links that each connect two nodes. The nodes include keywords that are in turn linked to a question and if the player can answer it correctly then the next path along his progression of the map will be uncovered. Players can choose the route that they want to proceed along depending on the theme or subject that they know most about to try to improve on their chances.

Map My Mind features different question types like for instance “order” and “pair-matching” questions and wildcards that the player can use to help him progress through the maps. These work by making answering the questions a little easier for the player. The 50% wildcard removes half of the possible answers and the “Ask the host” wildcard allows the player to doublecheck his answer before committing to it. While answering a question incorrectly will lock the question and effectively block the players progression path he can use up one of his three lifelines to unlock the question again and try it again. Exploring the map will allow the player to find and unlock more wildcards and lifelines for use but in order to access them the player must first complete a mini-game.

Map My Mind comes bundled with 15 maps covering different subjects including but not restricted to: Movies, Geography, Sports, Pop and Rock Music, Superheroes and History. There is also the possibility to download some extra maps covering other subjects.

In addition to the main Map mode the game includes a Trivia mode in which the player either has a limited time to answer a certain number of questions, or a survival mode where he can play until he answers a question incorrectly. The game offers online leader boards, which allow players to compare themselves to others in their region, country or around the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can zoon in and zoom out to better see the map
Match the characters and the movies
First question on the game board completed
Resume at the end of the game
Openning new nodes on the map

title: Map My Mind

description:
Ant Wars SE is basically a simple but very fast real-time-strategy game with ants as the main protagonists, where the only goal is to eradicate each and every enemy unit on the map. At the start of the game, the player can choose between three types of units, differing in one of three aspects: speed, agility and propagation. Propagation is especially important since units can't be built but are instead automatically generated in all anthills occupied by the player. At the start of each of the 51 missions the player mostly has only one anthill with a few units already inside at his disposal. Scattered around the map are uninhabited anthills and of course anthills owned by the enemy.

Since new units are generated in anthills, the player has to capture other anthills in order to increase production. This is accomplished by selecting one or more anthills with at least 7 ants in them and sending them to the desired target. If the player's army is greater than the one currently in that anthill, he'll vanquish the foes and gain control over the hill. Once every enemy anthill has been claimed by the player this way, he wins.

sample_screenshots.caption: Red tries a counter attack while I'm busy taking his lower hole.
Always important: points for the highscore.
The final assault on red is about to happen.
Managed to take over control of all the holes.

title: Ant Wars SE

description:
Chromixa is a puzzle game that requires the player to fill up empty geometric shapes by putting other geometric shapes of different proportions in it. To increase the complexity, each shape is composed of one or more colors, requiring the players not only to fit the shapes inside the form, but also rotate and place the shapes in such a way that the overlapping colors combine to match the color of the form. Once all shapes have found their position and have changed to a united color, the level has been successfully completed.

As the player progresses through the main game, he unlocks up to four arcade-style mini-games. Like the main game, they heavily rely on the use of color. "Bounce" for example features a ball of a specific color flying around inside an empty geometric shape. The player has to turn the shape in such a way that the ball hits the side of the same color, otherwise the game is lost. After the ball hits the correct side, he bounces back and changes his color.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ooooooookay...I have no idea how to solve that one.
Okay, which colors do I need to combine to get white again?

title: Chromixa

description:
Hotel Tycoon is a managerial game in which the player takes on the role of a tycoon in charge of a hotel business chain. The player starts out with a single hotel and can assign staff and determine the amenities that are available to the guests. Staff needs training and hotels need constant repairs to keep in good shape.

The player makes money from guests that stay in the hotel. The player can assign different stay rates for every day of the year and launch marketing campaigns to boost customers. The game also informs the player when various special events occur in the city in which the hotel is placed.

The player can expand to build or buy more hotels in various cities in the fictional game world. The whole game is presented through various dialogue screens with iconic graphics and a 2D world map.
title: Hotel Tycoon

description:
Love Love is a puzzle game in the style of Tetris and Dr. Mario. Blocks of two pieces moving from the top of the screen to the bottom and have to be combined with other blocks matching at least for of the same color to make the disappear. Removing more than one group of blocks will enable combos to ramp up the score.

The game features a colorful graphic and almost hypnotic ambient sounds.

sample_screenshots.caption: We made a block of four matching pieces
placing the first set of tiles
The colors will be influenced by new pieces

title: Love Love

description:
In iStunt the player controls a snowboarder, helping him to get to the finish of the level. In-between are hills, slopes, half-pipes, gabs and other more or less dangerous obstacles the player has to navigate while scoring additional points by making stunts. More points are earned by collecting gold stars hanging around the levels. The player can force the snowboarder to increase speed by holding him down with his finger, make him jump by sliding over the screen and tilt the device to produce back and frontflips. If the snowboarder lands on his head, falls down a hole or is killed by saw blades, the game is over and it restarts at the last checkpoint.

The game also plays with gravity, turning it upside down when the player drives over a yellow arrow and flipping the screen while doing so, forcing him to turn the device 180° in order to continue.

sample_screenshots.caption: The gravity is strange in these nets.
You need to rotate the cannon into the right position otherwise you'll die.

title: iStunt

alternate_titles.title: Banker Wars: Panique à la Maison Blanche

description:
Even though they already got paid, the bankers are still storming the White House in order to collect the rest of the available bailout money. The job of the player is to prevent that in this castle-defense-variant. To do so, the player can pick up the normal bankers, throw them around or shake them until their cloth fall off and they run away ashamed. Each type banker is vulnerable and immune to a specific attack. The second type of banker for example uses his briefcase to prevent the player from flinging him in the air and hoping he falls to his death.

To help the player with the increasing number of bankers, he can buy three types of defenses: a sniper, a tank and Uncle Sam. Each one has a solid automatic and a more powerful, manually triggered attack that thins the ranks of the bankers but requires more or less time to become available again. Uncle Sam for example activates a orbital laser which instantly kills any type of banker and seriously hurts the CEO. Each defense unit can be upgraded in several stages with the money dropped by killed bankers. Sometimes they even drop items like credit cards which need to be collected manually but significantly increase the money gained.

The game is divided into waves of increasing difficulty and ends once all of the bailout money has been stolen by the bankers.

sample_screenshots.caption: I shook that guy in the back so hard he lost his suit.
Using Uncle Sam to unleash hell on that CEO.
They come and come and come.

title: Bailout War$

description: Stop & Go puts the player in control of traffic. By switching the state of the traffic lights at the various intersections in the levels, he decides which cars go through and who has to wait. But the player can't let the cars wait too long. They'll start go get impatient and drive through even if the traffic light is currently red or they gas runs out. The ladder case requires the player to manually refuel them by moving a gas-canister over them. The game features different levels but has no goal other than getting as many cars as possible from one side of the screen to the other. It only ends when two cars crash into each other. This can either happen when the player switches the traffic light while another car is in the middle of the intersection or when the traffic jam gets so big that it goes out of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The traffic is high on this map.
Crash in the upper left corner...
High traffic in the upper left corner but none of mine concern right now.

title: Stop & Go

description:
In reMovem the player has to remove as many balls of the same color at the same time as possible. But only those balls can be removed that have direct contact to at least one other ball. Depending on the game-mode, there are up to six different colors on the board the player has to deal with. Once a group of same-colored balls has been removed, the balls above will fall down and will in the best case form another cloud of balls that is worth removing. The game ends either when the board is cleared or no two balls of the same color in direct contact are left to select and remove. The only goal is to get the highest score by playing as long as possible and always removing many balls of the same color at once.

To spice things up, there are four game-modes available to chose from. Besides the mentioned Basic-mode, these are:

  • Nonstop - When a column gets cleared, new balls are generated.
  • Slide - Plays the same as Basic but instead of only dropping down, the balls also slide to the right to fill the empty space when a cluster of balls is cleared.
  • Combo - Combines the game-modes Basic, Nonstop and Slide.

sample_screenshots.caption: The color-blind-mode features symbols on the balls.
Six-color-games are hard and mostly over fast.
The balls keep coming and coming.
New balls keep coming in from the left until I screw up.
Remove the blues on the right to increase the possible score for the red ones.

title: reMovem

description:
Itsy the Spider has only one goal: get as high as possible. And to fulfill that goal, he requires the help of the player. The player needs to tell Itsy at which flowers or other objects he needs to shoot his web at in order to climb higher and higher. While the brown flowers give him just a normal boost, the blue ones will fling him up considerably higher - if he hits them in the correct angle.

As Itsy advances up and over the buildings, he will encounter enemies he shouldn't hit with a web like glowing bees or cats. Hitting a cacti while being attached to it with a web is also not a good idea. All this will lead to an untimely death. Another way to die is to loose momentum by trying to hit a flower to far up the screen or taking to long to touch the next flower. In that case Itsy falls to his death.

sample_screenshots.caption: It all starts at the bottom...
Using a normal flower to get up.
The cacti can also be used to shoot your web at - but don't swing at them...
Look its Spider-Man - and he's knitting his net!

title: Itsy the Spider

description:
Sheeple is a puzzle-game in which the player needs to guide Sheep People (=Sheeple) to the star-shaped exits. Of course it's not just watching the Sheeple automatically go from A to B. Instead there are many obstacles in the way the player has to remove like crates that have to be moved out of the way, stone and ice rocks that need to be destroyed or streams that need to be crossed. To help the Sheeple, the player has a limited amount of time and tools available. He can build bridges, destroy ice rocks with a fireball and order the Sheeple to walk a little faster. The Sheeple meanwhile follow the given path and just turn around or go in another direction when they encounter an obstacle.

To further increase the difficultly in the later levels, not only multiple Sheeple need to be helped out but also the level-exits as well as the Sheeple are color-coded or the level-exit can only be used once and the other Sheeple need to find another.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using a lightning or something to destroy a rock.
Two sheeps are being beamed away to distant lands or something...
Used fireballs to clear the way.
One guy is free to go but the other still has a crate in his way (right side).

title: Sheeple

description:
Spazzle Gold is a Whac-A-Mole variant. The player has to use a mallet to hit critters who randomly pop up on a field and avoid hitting the cute cats which also play on the field. A successful hit scores the player points while missing a critter or hitting a cat will subtract some. In addition killing a cat costs the player a life. Once all lives are gone, the game is over. If the clock reaches zero on the other hand, the player advances to the next level.

Besides tapping each critter manually, the player also has access to a special attack. When he shakes the device and has at least one special mallet left, every critter and cat on the screen will be hit instantly. In addition gems and clocks pop up further increasing the points earned and available time respectively.

Besides the fields full of rabbits, the game features other scenarios like space and disco-aliens, some of which need to be bought in-game before use.

sample_screenshots.caption: I think that's supposed to be a spaceship.
The pistol in the lower window allows you to shake the whole screen and kill everything at once - including the cats.
Find the critter on this picture - and don't hit the cat!

title: Spazzle Gold

description:
As the name suggests, Mastermind is based on the famous board game of the same name. The player's goal is to guess the random secret code ín ten tries. To find the code, the player places pins with different colors or symbols on the board. Once the row has been filled, the game tells him how many pins have the correct symbol or color and are in the correct place. It won't however tell the player exactly which pins are correct, making it a game of trial and error.

The game features four difficulty levels starting on easy with a secret code which consists of four colors/symbols and can only contain one of the seven available colors to master with five colors/symbols, nine different colors and the increased challenge that the colors/symbols can be contained more than once in the secret combination.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing the color of the next pin.
Took me six tries to find the right combination.
up to my ninth try and I'm still too stupid for this game...

title: Mastermind

description:
Babe on a Beam is a casual game aimed at non-gamers. Using the iPhone's accelerometer the player balances a baby as it makes its way along beams in a construction site towards a bottle of milk.

New levels are released periodically in updates.

The game is presented in 3D with a doll-like baby and cardboard buildings with drawn windows.
title: Babe on a beam

description:
Steam Pirates is a side scrolling RPG where the player assumes control over (at first) Kat, a human that was raised on "Cat Island" by a couple of infertile cat people. As she grew older she was tormented by the other cat children for being different. Once she got older she decided it was time for her to set off and find out who she really was and where she came from.

The story line takes places several years after she set off to find her true identity and has now become a very successful mercenary.

The player receives missions from various NPCs. While traveling through the side-scrolling world, the player battles various different types of enemies, in a turn based RPG battle system, using different types of weaponry.

Throughout these various missions, the player receives new weapons and experience points, which result in a higher level, which then in turn results in more health/mana/damage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main character, Kat (on the right, with gun drawn) about to engage an enemy

title: Steam Pirates

description:
Tilian Wars is a Sci-Fi tower defense game. A group of aliens, known as the Tilians, are attempting to get into the player's stronghold. The basic objective is prevent these aliens from entering the stronghold by use of various weapons, including machine guns, rocket launchers and mines.

The gameplay is quite simple, as one would expect from any other tower defense game. The player places these various weapon along the path which the invaders take, in order to destroy the before entering the gates. Once the player has placed a weapon on the field of play, they have the opportunity to upgrade these weapons, 2 times, with currency they receive for successful enemy kills.
title: Tilian Wars

description:
It is 2200 A.D. and the Hordes of Octo invaded the Earth. It is your task to deliver the planet.

The goal in Alien Breaker is to destroy all battalions, represented by blocks on the screen, by bouncing a ball off of a horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen. The blocks are colored and ma change colors when hit, until they disappear. Levels are won by clearing all blocks from the screen and lost by letting the ball fall out of the bottom of the screen.

As some blocks are hit, 23 different bonus items can be released and fall down the screen. If the player catches them with the paddle, gameplay changes occur.

The game is comprised of 50 levels with 4 different enemy types and 2 bosses. The game also offers adapted gameplay using the accelerometer.
title: Alien Breaker

description: Jet Ball is a Breakout-variant very similar to Arkanoid. Using a paddle and a ball, the player has to destroy every last brick on the screen while making sure that the ball doesn't fall down the screen. Not every brick can be destroyed by one hit however. Some even can't be destroyed with the normal ball at all. In these cases the many different power-ups come in handy. They are dropped by destroying special glowing bricks on the board and activated by simply collecting them with the paddle. Besides power-ups like an increased paddle size, an acid ball which goes through everything or the ability to automatically shoot rockets for a short amount of time, there are also non-beneficial ones dropping like instant death or paddle-shrinkage.

sample_screenshots.caption: The red round blocks explode upon destruction.
The red ball plants a mine upon hitting a block.
The acid-balls are very, very useful.

title: Jet Ball

description:
This release of Siberian Strike includes the whole story and features all the levels which where previously released in two parts as Siberian Strike and Siberian Strike: Episode II. The goal of the game is the destruction of the Stalin-Bot, a crossbreed of Stalin and the future MIR Space Station, who owns the vodka producing company Stalinka Corp. The company is behind a communist invasion because they produce genetically engineered vodka that completely annihilates the willpower of those who drink it.

To do the job, the player can choose between one of three pilots and airplanes at the start of the story mode. While Eliza McCampbell's R-51 Thunder is the fastest plane in the game, it's not very powerful. Pappy T. Wilder on the other hand uses the B-27 Sicarius, a slow but powerful bomber. The third pilot is Eliott Freeman with his balanced P-69 Conquest. Each plane also features four different paint-jobs which need to be unlocked first by playing through the game with that plane. In addition, additional difficulty levels become only available after killing the Stalin-Bot.

The main part of the game is a vertical-scrolling top-down-shooter. The player moves his plane around the screen in order to avoid the enemy projectiles while firing all available cannons and collecting the power-ups dropped by destroyed enemies. These include more powerful weapons as well as extra lives or a shield which makes the player immune to all damage for a few seconds. If the player destroys a group of enemies who all belong to the same squad, a medal drops. Once the player has collected 100, an additional continue becomes available after all his lives have been lost, allowing him to get right back in the game - although without all the power-ups he had upon death. Most of the levels feature one or more bosses.

In a few levels, the game switches to a third-person-perspective. Here, the player's main goal is to avoid the many obstacles in his path while the game automatically targets the automatic turrets along the route. The player just has to press a button once targeting has been completed. These levels also don't feature any power-ups.

The game features a Wi-Fi-multiplayer-mode in which two players shoot their way to the Stalin-Bot cooperatively.

sample_screenshots.caption: The end is near and more and more enemies are on the screen at the same time.

title: Siberian Strike

description:
Similar to games like Bridge Builder, the player has to build a bridge over a gap using limited resources with the goal of helping up to nine animals get across. The animals weigh differently with the parrot being the most light and the mammoth the most fat one so the player has to make sure his bridge is solid enough to take the weight - at least for a short amount of time. The bridges itself consist of planks of a certain maximum length which can only be connected to other planks or anchor points around the gaps.

To increase the stability without spending all the available wood, some levels feature a bungee-rope that can be connected to the anchor-points of the planks. Some levels on the other hand don't feature any anchor-points at all at the start. In these cases, the player has to look for destructible scenery in order to create anchor-points. And other levels even require the player to change the location of the sun to influence the water-level and reveal new anchor-points.

While the level is already completed once all the animals are safely across, to really master a level, the player has to do it using the least amount of planks and at the same collect all the golden eggs that are scattered around the level and may not be on the easiest path over the gap.

sample_screenshots.caption: What a professional bridge, although the elephant does strain it a bit (the light red bar)
The elephant is the most critical element.

title: Bridge Odyssey

description:
The player takes over the control of Xio, a robot looking very much like one of the transformers. His mission is to free the Domain from rogue software that has taken over that special world with the sole intention of corrupting and destroying it.

Denizen is a rail-shooter very similar to Star Fox both in look and gameplay. The player automatically flies through the levels with only the ability to move Xio around the screen and ordering him to shoot at incoming enemies. Flying into the screen from both the front and the back, the player has to do his best to avoid their projectiles and kill them as fast as possible. To do so he can either target them one by one or swipe the screen to shoot at more than one at the same time. Additionally, if the situation becomes too desperate for Xio, he can use a bomb, clearing the whole screen by doing so. At the end of each level a boss awaits.

sample_screenshots.caption: One enemy down - two to go.
Enemies aren't just coming toward you - they also enter the screen from behind.
Earned a ton of bagdes in the last level.

title: Denizen

description:
KartToon Rally is a typical kart racing game. Players choose between four cartoon characters (Robbie Duckie, Piggie Smalls, Ricky Raccoon, and Racer Rex) and race against a number of opponents. Each of the nine tracks has a specific theme such as lava, ice and desert.

The game features various different power-ups that can be used to gain an advantage or thwart other players.

Game modes include Grand Prix, Time Trial and Free Play. All tracks can be raced in normal or mirrored mode.

The game can be played using touch controls or steering through tilting the device.
title: KartToon Rally

description:
Blue Defense! is a classic shooter game. You are the defender of the blue planet have to destroy the incoming red fleet. The planet fires a constant stream of bullets directly upwards. By tilting or even rotating the device you can aim at incoming enemies. The planet starts with roughly 6.7 billion inhabitants. Every impacting enemy kills part of the population and the game ends when the last inhabitant is killed.

The game is essentially endless, i.e. it is all about surviving as long as possible and getting a high score. The scoring is innovative; every enemy killed will increase a score multiplier and therefore increase the rate at which you get points in the future. Every hit your planet takes will halve the multiplier, however. There are a number of different levels but the order is random every time you play the game. The game also gets faster the further you progress. It is also possible to directly select and practice a particular level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enemies attacking from all sides now. The key to victory is...
... to rotate the phone quickly and fire in all directions. Hope you don't have headphones attached :)
Fighting four large carriers at the same time is a real challenge
This boss spawns smaller carriers that in turn spawn swarmers

title: Blue Defense!

description:
In Doppelgänger you need to help Frank Blank to remember.

The game is a singleplayer arcade version of the Memory. On each stage identical pairs of cards have to be found. You are given only a certain amount of attempts. Too many misses will cause you to go "game over".

The amount of cards varies between the stages, rising slowly the difficulty. Each level has a specific theme for the graphics on the cards.

sample_screenshots.caption: Try to find these in a bonus level that shows every 5 levels

title: Doppelgänger

description:
The goal of War Evolved is simple: Destroy the enemy's base. To do so, the player has access to up to five different units (three land and two air) which he/she builds and upgrades in exchange for gold. Once a unit is finished, it will automatically walk from the player's base to the enemy base on a side-scrolling 2D-plane. If an enemy unit crosses its path, they'll fight until one of them is destroyed with the winner earning the same amount of gold the owner of the destroyed unit paid for it. In addition turrets are available to defend the base even when an enemy unit makes it through.

The game starts with both parties controlling cavemen and dinosaurs but over the course of the game, the era changes to Ancient Egypt, Medieval Ages, the Wild Wild West, World War II to the present day. With it, the available units and upgrades change. While at first there's a caveman with a club, in the end the player will build F14s, helicopters and armored vehicles to destroy the enemy's base.

If fighting the AI gets boring, two players can either engage in combat on the same device or through a WiFi-connection.

sample_screenshots.caption: The evolution of the background doesn't have to happen at the same time as the evolution of the units.
The wild, wild west is up next.
Destroyed an enemy plane and got 161 points for it.
The game starts out back in the da when dinosaurs ruled the land and blonde cavegirls played pilot.

title: War Evolved

description:
"Destroy the enemy base!" - that's all the instructions the player needs in Empire At War to understand what its all about. But before he gets to see the simple 2D-battlefield with his own base on the left and the enemies base on the right side from a fixed side-perspective, he needs to choose for which of the four nations including Rome and Greece. Each of the nations not only differs in looks but also features different units including their very own strengths and weaknesses.

Once in the game, the player builds offensive and defensive land-based units (like a simple stone defender) and watches them walk automatically to the enemy base and engage the enemy once in range. These fights last until one of the units dies after which the victor continues his path to the enemy base. To build, upgrade and by doing so gaining the advantage over the enemy player, gold is needed which is earned automatically (slow) or by killing enemy units (faster). In addition killing enemy units will earn the player experience points. Once enough have been collected, a level up advances the player to the next of up to five technological evolutions unlocking new types of units as well as additional upgrades.

The game features a multiplayer-mode for two players using a bluetooth-connection.

sample_screenshots.caption: The enemy base is almost done for.
My war elephant is about to die.
Roman cavalry is very powerful with the highest upgrade.
I won - although it took a very, very long time.

title: Empires at War

description:
In the game, you play as Klink, a robot vacuum cleaner that has a mission of cleaning the house of all of the dust bunnies that have taken over various rooms of the house. To eliminate the various types of dust bunnies, you must tap (or tap and drag your finger) each dust bunny on the screen - this targets the dust bunny and forces Klink to shoot a pine solvent missile at the enemy. If you tap the right or left side of the screen, you are able to move the camera a bit in that direction to reveal more of the area you are trying to clean (and more dust bunnies). When dust bunnies appear in the parts of the level that are off screen, an alarm sounds warning you that you should move the camera to reveal more dust bunnies.

Each level consists of a different room in a house. In order to complete a level and move on to the next, you must complete each levels objective. Objectives consist of various tasks such as killing a certain number of dust bunnies, defeating a boss dust bunny, and killing dust bunnies with a certain type of weapon. The game also has 2 different game modes - Campaign, where you progress level by level, and Survivor mode where you try to last in a single level as long as possible.
title: Attack of the Dust Bunnies

description:
Defender Chronicles: Legend of The Desert King is in general a tower defense game that adds role playing elements to its gameplay.

You free certain areas of a world map by surviving waves of enemies trying to pass your gate at every level. Your hero protects the last gate of each level, but additional weapons will be needed. You will need to man certain points of each level with swordsmen, archers, mages or halflings. Every unit can be upgraded and you will have to find the balance of units to fight back the waves of enemies. Defeated enemies net you gold that can be spend on new units or upgrades.

Your hero earns experience in every fight, the higher the difficulty (there are 4 levels) the higher the earned experience points. The experience can be spend on your hero's stats. This might enhance the hero's health points and attack rate or his commanding bonus' towards your units which will result in increased health points and attack rates.

In addition to the experience points tokens can be earned at each victory to buy gear for your hero or spell-like items that will aid you in battle, like an additional unit to support your hero in battle.

sample_screenshots.caption: Spend tokens for your hero's gear
the limited budget won't allow us to build stronger units at first...
Choose the difficulty before each level

title: Defender Chronicles: Legend of The Desert King

description:
Sword & Poker 2 combines classic Poker game features with RPG elements.

In a magical world based on cards your hero returns home from his battles fought in the predecessor. Soon he is called for battle once more to fight back the dark shadow starting to cover the entire continent.

Through a world map the player chooses a dungeon to go into. Each dungeon consists of several levels with a handful of enemies each. Once facing an enemy the player's goal will be to reduce its hit-points by forming a row of cards you know from the Poker card games. A flush is worth more hit-points than a pair of two cards.

The player will find 3x3 cards in each level. His or her deck of cards will then be used to add two cards per turn on each side of the 3x3 board. One card opposites the second forming five cards in a row.

Defeating enemies earns the player gems that can be spent on new bags (increased hit-points), new weapons (stronger attack rate) or shields.

sample_screenshots.caption: A new bag for increased hit-points
A new deck is served as we did not manage to end the game quickly
You have three slots to save your games
The enemy got stunned by our first move, so we strike again

title: Sword & Poker II

description:
Blue Attack is the sequel to Blue Defense by the same author. You control a starfighter launched from the blue carrier and must destroy the red ships before they reach and destroy your carrier. Your fighter may be accompanied by up to 8 wingmen that increase your firepower. The game is essentially a 2D shooter. The blue squadron can either be controlled with the accelerometer or using a touch interface. Red ships are complex geometrical shapes that must be destroyed step by step. Every ship contains a core that must be destroyed in order to blow up the whole ship.

The ultimate goal of the game is to destroy the red planet. In campaign mode you select your next attack target on a map screen. You cannot select the difficulty directly; instead, more difficult levels only become available if you have completed the previous level below a time limit. There is also an infinite mode where you simply try to survive wave after wave. In between levels you can buy upgrades for your fighters, buy single-use items like bombs or replace lost fighters. Completing levels faster earns you more resources to spend in the shop.

sample_screenshots.caption: A massive red ship. Attacking the front may not be the best idea.
In campaign mode you select the next level on a map. More difficult level are only available if you beat the time limit of the previous level.
Our carrier has been destroyed - Game Over!
The core of this ship lies open, it will not last much longer.

title: Blue Attack!

description: SkullPogo is a casual arcade-style approach to zombie-killing via skeleton on a pogo-stick. By tilting the iPhone (or configureably using touch) you manipulate Skullboy on a pogostick to knock out pigs, zombies, bats, and other mischievous creatures to build combos. Skullboy constantly jumps and the player only has to direct him left or right to keep the combo going. You may utilize power-ups and combo-specials to really rack up your score. The game consists of different levels.
title: SkullPogo

description:
Lucky Loot is a score based casual game. The player gets to score in 4 different areas by pickpocketing as many people as he or she can before getting busted.

All 4 areas allow infinite gameplay, so players can keep on scoring as long as they can keep up!

Players can also upload their high scores on Facebook and share them with their friends.
title: Lucky Loot

description: In Red Remover you must, obviously, remove all the shapes that have red coloring. The light red shapes can be removed by selecting them but the dark red shapes can only be removed by dropping them off the screen. Shapes with green must remain on the screen to clear the level. Blue shapes are neutral. Removing them is up to you. The shapes follow physics so they will, depending on their shape, roll or slide. Unlike the browser version, this version features 80 levels.
title: Red Remover

description: Soul Trapper is an audio adventure that draws from the history of radio mystery dramas and the nostalgia of choose-your-own-adventure games. This is the first episode in a series that relies on voice actor performance and stereo sound design, rather than a visual interface, as the primary means of "display" for the game world. It is a science fiction mystery adventure title centered around the player character Kane Price, a psychic investigator specializing in solving problems of a supernatural nature in the present day Los Angeles area. The game mixes exploration and puzzle play with a narrative that lasts around three hours. In this first episode, Ollie Ollie Oxen Free!, Kane Price and his associates chase ghosts, avoid the law, battle demons and solve a mystery surrounding a lost boy named Ollie. The game has visuals, but these are largely static and the next action is selected based on a number of options presented on the screen. At the bottom of the screen a map can be opened to get an overview of the different locations.
title: Soul Trapper: Episode 1 - Ollie Ollie Oxen Free!

description:
Atlantis Oceans is a side-scrolling action game that takes place underwater. As the explorer Francesca Carlyle, you visit diving locations around the world in search for some special artifacts from Atlantis. The game is packed with artifacts (diamonds, Egyptian statues, gold) and offers a wide variety of fish to capture and sharks to fight.

Once artifacts have been collected, they can be sold and the money earned is used to upgrade your equipment: knife, spear-gun, dynamite, scooter and more.
title: Atlantis Oceans

description: The Monter Tree is ill, and only one flying squirrel can save it. Throughout the game you explore a large world, set up in the same style as Metroid and Castlevania, but with game-play closely resembling a shooter game. At the start of the game, different parts are locked out. However, as you find power ups you can use these to get past the obstacles and get into the locked away area. This in turn gives you access to another power up, which can help you reach the next area. All until you reach your goal: finding the cause of the Mother Tree's illness and cure it.
title: Phoenix Spirit

description:
Fall of Atlantis 2.0 game is a cross between a common platform game and a Bust-a-Move puzzle game where you have to solve puzzles to open new paths in the game.

Set in an ancient Greek setting, you take on the role as Atlas, king of Atlantis, to save your kingdom from destruction. The path between you and your goal is filled with obstacles which you first must survive. On your way you can also complete a lot of challenges to unlock achievements.

sample_screenshots.caption: Don't look her in the eyes!

title: Fall of Atlantis 2.0

description:
In the Late 1960′s, Torgan Science developed a low-cost, shipping system that instantaneously teleported packages to their destinations. While experimenting with human cargo, a catastrophic system failure ripped a portal into a parallel dimension. Thirteen Torgan scientists were pulled in, but only one reached the final destination.

Further exploration was deemed too dangerous, until now…

The creation of the Torgan Science Amateur Explorer Program (TSAEP) has delivered the means to safely navigate and explore this hostile dimension. As a new recruit, you’ll use your iPhone to remotely control an advanced Rover Explorer. Chart new territory and deploy outpost beacons for other Pilots. Exploration is rewarded with credits to use on upgrades and repairs — so you can explore more. Battle the hostile inhabitants as you blast your way through this uncharted frontier and discover the secrets of the Torgan 13.

Ghosts Attack is a first person shooter for the iPhone that integrates real time mapping technology with a dynamic alternate reality gaming experience. Unravel a story regarding the disappearance of thirteen scientists — accidentally transported to a parallel dimension in a failed teleportation experiment. The company that employed the scientists is now dispatching remote controlled Rovers to explore and conquer the new realm. The game is continuously updated with new content, ranging from in-game updates to new episodes.
title: Ghosts Attack

description:
Rolando 2: Quest for the Golden Orchid is the sequel to Rolando. Like its predecessor the player controls Rolandos by selecting them and tilting the screen to make them roll left or right in their side-scrolling world. The player can further manipulate items in the world to have the Rolandos reach their desired destination.

This times a deadly curse plagues the land and the Rolandos have to find a cure, which involves finding a golden orchid.

Unlike the first game which is completely 2D the game now makes use of 3D geometry, although gameplay still takes place in a two dimensional plane. The game features all new puzzles, abilities and action sequences.
title: Rolando 2: Quest for the Golden Orchid

alternate_titles.title: U-Ventures: Deep in the Cave of Time

description:
79-year-old Edward Packard, founder of the Choose-Your-Own-Adventure line and cut out of the loop by ChooseCo franchise revival, makes a bid for his slice of the pie in this expanded digital adaptation of his original interactive book by the same name which was first published in a 16-ending version in 1985, book #50 of the original gamebook line and sequel to The Cave of Time, the very first in the CYOA franchise.

The game presents updated text from the books (goodbye, pay phones -- hello, cell phones!) in several branching, forking narrative threads at the book's titular nexus of the timestream, wherein the player directs the actions and decisions of the protagonist through several junctions where they get to choose one of two or three situationally-appropriate options offered, here by touching the screen to select the desired choice. The story then proceeds down that selected narrative avenue, with its own unforeseen complications, until reaching another junction requiring the player's decision-making input. This adaptation not only incorporates illustrations as did the original, but the multimedia capabilities of the new platform allow sound and other special effects to be part of the gamebook players' experience.

This gamebook adaptation promises to be the first in a tentative three-game conversion deal..
title: U-Ventures: Return to the Cave of Time

description:
A soul is trapped inside a world of paintings. Guide it through the strange and puzzling labyrinths of Cameltry as you attempt to escape from this bizarre world.

Cameltry: The Labyrinth of Enigma is a puzzle game based on the arcade game, Cameltry. This version of the game has received a new look and theme, based around paintings. Your goal, however, remains the same. Rotate the maze around to guide the ball to the goal line. Gravity always pulls downward, so you can navigate around obstacles by moving the maze itself. Coins are littered around the maze which increase your score. Later levels introduce plus symbol pickups (which increase your time) and minus symbol pickups (which decrease it). Whenever you complete a level, your time is presented and converted into points. You also receive extra time for you to continue playing.
title: Cameltry: The Labyrinth of Enigma

description:
Mega Fill-Up is a fixed screen action game where you have to "grow" balloons to fill 2/3 of the screen space without getting hit by enemies.

These enemies are represented by red dots that bounce around the screen. Their numbers and speed varies per level. The player has a limited number of lives and loses a life whenever the bouncing balls hit a balloon the player is currently inflating so it is vital to try to block them to small areas with balloons.
title: Mega Fill-Up

description: In Druid Quest the player controls a druid that can only move in four directions and can't stop moving until he hits an obstacle. The aim is to move through a level and reach the exit. Moving out of the screen is penalized.
title: Druid Quest

description:
WINtA is a music game created for charity and designed by Masaya Matsuura know from games such as PaRappa the Rapper and other music games.

WINtA stands for "War is not the answer" and refers to the title track. Each track is specifically designed with unique graphics and style. The game itself is free and comes with the title track for free. The other tracks can be bought in-game for 99 cents and the proceeds go to charity. New tracks are added periodically to the WINtA store.

In the game the player is presented with icons in different patterns depending on the song. Some icons will start glowing whenever words are sung. They need to be tapped by the player at the right moment. The better the player times his taps the more point the player earns. Getting chains of correct taps earns multipliers for even more points. To add to the difficulty the camera moves along a predefined path and the playing field isn't sitting still either. When the player fails to tap an icon the words aren't sung out of tune. Special icons function as a whammy and can be shaken with a finger to add effects to the lyrics.

Using Plus+ the player can collect achievements and compare scores with friends or global leaderboards.
title: WINtA

description: The player controls an Arabian Nights-styled cat, complete with turban and flying carpet. This feline must have tricked an Efreet into surrendering some of its power, since it can shoot bolts of flame from its paw as it soars across the sky -- and must either attack (by tapping) or evade (by tilting the device) various bat-like enemies filling the night sky above the minaret-studded cityscape below. Naturally, there are also plenty of bonuses to collect, if the player can successfully navigate into them and away from the opponents. This game plays for high scores, and the player is always fighting a clock ticking down.
title: Flight of Fire

description:
Drag N Drop is a puzzle matching game that tests the player's reaction time, observations, and patience. There are dozens of great sound tracks with numerous background themes. The game has over 170 grids, 8 stunning eye catching backgrounds, 4 win medals including bronze, silver, gold, and platinum. Additionally, players can track their high score for bragging rights.

Blocks have to be combined through rotation, dragging and dropping shiny blocks with speed and accuracy. The player can opt between three different control methods to play the game.
title: Drag N Drop

description: Beat! is a score based memory/rhythm game in which players tap a collection of up to six colored cubes, each representing a unique musical pitch, in sync with the game's soundtrack. The AI will light up the cubes in a sequence and the player will need to tap on the colored cubes in the same order similar to the electronic game Simon Says. With each successful reproduction, the sequence will get longer and longer, testing the players memory to the limit! Players are rewarded with a higher score if they can tap the cubes in sync in the rhythm of the background music. The game also has leaderboards that tracks the highest player scores.
title: Beat! Music Memory Match

description: impaXor uniquely mixes color-matching and arcade defense gameplay together. The objective of the game is to stop the enemies from destroying the Earth by crashing into it. The player must match a color-coded laser to an enemy's color in order to attack the selected target and ultimately eliminating it. Many types of enemies are presented during play, from laser toting UFOs to giant toilets. As the game progresses, the enemies speed up and start attacking in different patterns raising the difficulty. The overall feel of impaXor is reminiscent of classic arcade games with a modern twist.

sample_screenshots.caption: Destroying red asteroid heading towards Earth

title: impaXor

description:
Traveler's Quest is a unique treasure hunting game which uses the GPS to help players detect and bury treasures. Treasures detected are buried by other players, or by "treasure gnomes" which help out lonely players. Because the game expects players to move around the world, treasure value changes based on location. The more distance a player puts between the treasure's origin and his or her current location, the more the treasure is worth. Therefore burying a treasure as far away from the origin is very important to the player's daily gold income which is received for every 24 hours a treasure is buried. Extra points are given when collections are completed, and the closer the player is to a treasure's X before picking it up.

Additionally, rather than a single overall score leaderboard, this game also contains leaderboards for Gold, Treasure Value, Collections and Accuracy. Game Center was also added in the most recent release, allowing players to compare their achievements with their friends.
title: Traveler's Quest

alternate_titles.title: U-Ventures: Lost in the Black Hole

description:
The second in the U-Ventures line, this digital gamebook adaptation revises Edward Packard's Choose Your Own Adventure of the same name, originally published as #97 in that line way back in 1990.

Simple forking-narrative gamebooks, these U-Ventures feature no randomization, skill tests or inventory use; gameplay consists solely of making selections at plot crossroads and then reading, seeing and hearing what happens next from that branch -- until getting to the next choice or reaching one of the game's numerous endings. This one begins with the player on Earth, preparing to be sent on a mission out into the cosmos... with many creative, disparate hypothetical possibilities awaiting on the other side of the event horizon.
title: U-Ventures: Through the Black Hole

description: Marble Blast Mobile is an iOS version of the Marble Blast series. The game is similar to the other Marble Blast releases in that the player uses first-person shooter style controls to navigate a marble through an obstacle course in a limited amount of time. It combines elements, graphics, and levels from both Marble Blast Ultra and Marble Blast Gold.
title: Marble Blast Mobile

description: Mini Monster Smash has the player smashing a monster as far as they can with a flyswatter. Players swipe their finger across the screen to swing the flyswatter, and the monster then flies bouncing off of trampolines, bombs and floating in bubbles. The game supports Apple's GameCenter with a leaderboard and 26 achievements.
title: Mini Monster Smash

description:
The successor to the NBA Live franchise begins on iPhone, allowing you to play as any of the 30 NBA teams through a full 82 game season and the playoffs, or straight into an exhibition game. Every player across the league is available for traditional 5 on 5 gameplay, as well as legends of the game that can be unlocked during play to mix things up. You can also compete in a 3 point shoot out, or the All-Star game itself.

Touch screen controls are split into two move sets. The simplest moves are controlled by an on-screen control pad and two action buttons, that change whether you are on offence or defence. Advanced moves such as unique dribbles or dunks can be performed with swipes or double taps on or across the screen during play.
title: NBA Elite 11

description: Caveman Runner is an action game where you collect steaks and avoid cactuses in a randomly generated scrolling desert that gets faster and faster the more steaks you get! You can unlock a Sprint bonus that lets you go faster temporarily by tapping it at the risk of hitting a cactus. Its an infinitely expandable game and there are plans to add many more actions with risk and reward like Sprint.

sample_screenshots.caption: From the February "Love is in the air" version

title: Caveman Runner

description:
Fight Night Champion allows the player to fight as boxing legends past and present, including Mike Tyson and Muhammad Ali. Intuitive controls help the player launch various types of punches in order to throw the opponent to the ground using swipes and flicks.

Legacy Mode allows the player to build a fighter or use one of the preselected characters and start a career journey towards being champion of the world. Quick matches or challenging friends over Wi-Fi/Bluetooth are also possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Points can be spent on increasing health, stamina, and damage

title: Fight Night Champion

description:
Robot Story is a puzzle game where the player controls a robot called Bot. Each level consists of one or more pair of gears which Bot has to jam in order to complete the level. Bot has only two tools, a wrench, and a dynamite. Each level has a fixed number of each of tool. In order to advance, the player need to stop all the gears before running out of tools. Other gameplay elements include magnets, which may be turned on/off by jamming a gear, and breakable blocks which may be destroyed with the dynamite.

The game features similar gameplay to Angry Birds. Both games calculate a level score based on the number of resources used, and elements crushed, such as glass walls. The only controllable part of the game is which tool to use, and which direction and power to use in the throwing of the tool.
title: Robot Story

description: iHurt is a downhill ragdoll simulation filled with humor. In iHurt the player must rack up a high dollar hospital bill by guiding the main character into objects like trees, rocks, beehives, TNT, and more while collecting coins. As of now there are three characters to choose from and 7+ levels to play.
title: iHurt

alternate_titles.title: Doodle Fill: An Addictive Casual Game For All

description:
There is an old topographical chestnut illustrated as a political cartography problem: if you have a map with a given number of countries clustered on it, what is the fewest amount of colours you can use to give each region a different colour without bordering on another region sharing its colour? It's rather more intellectual than this game, but ultimately they share the same concern.

This game presents a number of aesthetically pleasing abstract geometrical line drawings in black and white, divided up into various complete segments. At the player's disposal are four pencil crayons, each of a different colour. The player's challenge in a given level (and there are a lot of them) is to colour in every part of each level's drawing -- tapping on a crayon and then the area flood-fills the area -- without having any two adjacent areas of the same colour. Making things interesting, every level has a time limit -- and your own manual dexterity on the small iPhone screen may vary. Areas coloured in error can be re-coloured as often as you like, but the clock is always ticking.

sample_screenshots.caption: Just so you could observe the negative consequences of failing to meet the time limit
This one, nearly solved, is a lovely visual composition.
Thank you; actually, I am a brain surgeon.

title: Doodle Fill

description:
Nitedals Fyrstikker (English translation: Nitedal's Matches) is a puzzle game where the player has to move a limited number of matches to form a shape as described in the objective.

For each purchase 1 Norwegian Crown is given to charity. This is similar to how a little share of Nitedal's matchboxes are donated to the same fund: "hjelpestikkefondet".

sample_screenshots.caption: Initial state, use only three moves to form a rectangle. Since this is a training level, the gray areas form a hint to the solution.

title: Nitedals Fyrstikker

description:
Released as a free game in promotion of the TRON movie sequel Tron: Legacy, this game features both a light cycle mode, and a tank mode. Both versions are available in singleplayer mode and both were available as multiplayer for online play initially. There are also some promotional information for the movie tie-in such as information about the soundtrack by Daft Punk, and information about the movie.

The single player version of light cycles consist of levels where all other light cycles has to be destroyed in order to continue. The player has a limited number of lives, and have to survive a few waves of AI respawns in order to complete the level. The bikes can run over power-ups to gain access to improvements such as longer light trails, faster speed, and temporary "god mode" where the player can run through walls. Online game featured similar gameplay except that the game never ended, and all players respawned as long as they were connected.

The tank game is a puzzle game in single player mode where the player needs to get to the exit by destroying enemies, items that block the path, and reaching switches that opens closed areas. The tanks has two primary weapons with unlimited ammo, as well as a few limited ones that can only be found in power-ups. Multiplayer version featured only a death match type against other players.

Online playing were always team mode, where each player selected one of three factions. The only distinction between the teams are their colors, green, cyan, and orange. Each point go towards an persistent overall faction score. The multiplayer servers were shut down, and the features were removed from the app late in 2011.

sample_screenshots.caption: Games menu - Tanks or Light Cycles

title: Tron

description:
The Heist is introduced with a vault that can only be unlocked by solving mini-games. The mini-games include:* A game similar to Unblock me where the objective is to get a certain block to the exit point on the right side of the screen. Some blocks can only be moved vertically, while other can only be moved horizontally

  • A Sudoku-type of game, where the player needs to place symbols on a field, and make sure that each symbol is unique on each column and row, as well as within a group

  • A Sokoban-type of game, where the player needs to move some crates to some defined positions on the screen

  • A sliding block puzzle, where the objective is to make a wire connection from one end to the other

The game also has alternative reality attributes as the player receives fictive "phone calls" while playing. The interface while receiving such a call is almost identical to the interface while receiving an actual call on the iPhone.

sample_screenshots.caption: A sokoban mini-game where two of three crates are in their sockets.
A completed version of the sliding puzzle.
The calling screen is almost identical to the iPhone interface.

title: The Heist

description:
Anadea is a puzzle solving game in which the player is tasked to make the small anadea pieces reach their goal. Each anadea is restricted to a specific path with nodes. It can only move forward if the same color or shape is ahead.

The main goal of this puzzle game is to construct Anadea’s path by organizing shapes and/or colors before the time runs out.
title: Anadea

description: Colorblind is a color-matching game where players are shown a swatch of color on one screen, then taken to another screen where they must match that color using slider bars that adjust the amount of red, green, and blue in a blank swatch. The created color is then matched against the original, and players are scored on accuracy. Several hint functions are available to assist the player. Games are averaged over eight stages, and scores can be saved and shared on the OpenFeint gaming network.

sample_screenshots.caption: Then they must reproduce it on the next screen
Hint buttons can only be used once per game; "Show Red" one sets the red slider to the right value

title: Colorblind

description: Branded with ironic overstatement, this game provides a curious play mechanic -- presenting the player with a precarious written situation, the player gets two options of on-screen buttons to tap on: a large one, promising game-ending failure, or a small one, which, when tapped precisely the requisite dozen, hundred or thousand times (simulating "grinding" mechanics in other games), will progress the story and advance the player to the next plot crossroads.The instructions tell us that the game's primary difficulty, beyond the built-in tedium, is in preventing one's friends from accessing one's game unawares and hitting the big, lurid game-ending button, in which event a player's progress is enshrined as a high score.
title: Epic RPG

description: Beefing up Progress Quest's gameplay with some interface beautification, the designers of this game have concluded that the best part of an RPG is in fact generating the character, which is achieved through player customization on the touchscreen, following which the player gets to sit back and enjoy monitoring the automated adventuring of their character through stock Medieval/Fantasy scenarios (as reported by status line updates and a couple of bar indicators)... at least, provided they can resist the temptation to press the "Win Game" button.

sample_screenshots.caption: An early hero, on level 4.  (Yes, my avatar is a pair of boots.)
A more advanced hero, up on level 7.
Some of the player's key skills.

title: Simple RPG

description: An ostensibly humourous existential look at life in the modern era, this game presents the player with the life of Person Q. Anybody, a 21-year-old average Joe fresh out of school, with a certain number of hours to mark until retirement (and then, dying) several decades later. How will the player choose to while away those hours? Typical (by which we mean both usual and mundane) options are presented and can be selected on the touchpad screen, including a ubiquitous "end game" mechanism not much seen since Boppin'.

sample_screenshots.caption: Experiencing everything there is to experience.
Work also can be done with me.

title: The Futility of the Existence of the Modern Era Wage Slave

description: Another conversion of ADVENTURE, the first text adventure game, this one adds illustrations, a banner advertising-supported revenue model, and streamlines the text parser to two menus (as in Lucasfilm's Labyrinth) -- of verbs and nouns -- which players can use to assemble correct input needed to navigate a series of underground caves strewn with wonderful treasures and magical hazards and opponents. The eternal goal remains for the player to collect all the treasures strewn throughout the cave system (modeled after Kentucky's real-life Mammoth Cave complex) and gather them in the trophy room.
title: The Cave Adventure

description:
Returning to the minimalist roots of the text adventure genre, this game puts the player in charge of a protagonist who awakens, bewildered, in the sick bay of a complex on an alien planet. Navigation of the environment and its hazards is achieved by forming VERB NOUN phrases combining one of four actions on the bottom of the screen (LOOK, USE, TAKE, MOVE) with nouns selectable from room-specific lists. Players will quickly determine that the complex is infested with some species of lethal extraterrestrial life, and survival gets added to the typical adventure game priorities of exploration and puzzle-solving.

The game was initially released as a $1 download, but is now available for free.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting location, making an action phrase

title: Alien: Text Adventure

description: Dizzypad - Frog Jump Fun is a casual game that features a simple challenge: jump a frog across a pond filled with spinning lily pads. The goal is to jump as far as possible from spinning pad to spinning pad. Skip pads to earn extra flowers. Unlock new frog skins by earning various awards and compete with others through online leaderboards.
title: Dizzypad - Frog Jump Fun

description:
Snake Race is a combination between a snake game, and a constant scrolling game (such as a Shoot 'em up game). Unlike other snake games, there is no possible way to turn around, the snake can only be led in two directions; right-up, or left-up. Also unlike other snake games, the snake will not die instantly if it hits rocks blocking it paths. Instead some of it's length will be spent in order to drill through these barriers. In addition to the classic power-up where the snake grows, there are power-ups to speed up, or down the movement, as well as some only for more points. Since growing longer can be compared to getting more health in other types of games, the game actually become easier when getting long.

Unless the player dies by spending all of the snake's length, the game will end after a while, depending on what level is selected. A high score is determined based on how many power-ups the snake was able to eat. The score is also constant granting point as long as the snake is alive. Other bonuses may also grant points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Achievements and high-score for this level.

title: SnakeRace

description:
Button Smasher is a fast-paced game in which the player must touch the buttons at the bottom of the game screen to clear the highlighted shapes at the end of the loop. Both speed and accuracy are rewarded in this game. The player can earn bonus points for sequential smashes, but must try not to break the chain. highscores can be shared on Facebook and Twitter.

A tutorial and OpenFeint integration are included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over but I got a high score
Game screen showing bonus points earned.

title: Button Smasher

description: Aliens from Cowtopia is a cartoony action puzzle game where the player saves goofy cows from a fast-food restaurant's slaughterhouse by guiding them into abducting alien beams. The player must trace paths on a grass field and move cows to glowing spots on the screen. While doing so, the player must make sure cows do not collide or they start making noise and wake up a grumpy farmer who then pushes the cows in the slaughterhouse. The game features two game modes, online leaderboards and is filled with over-the-top visuals and features many hidden jokes.
title: Aliens from Cowtopia

description: A choose-your-own-adventure for horny frat boys, this automated conversion of the author's novel (also available as a PDF for e-readers) puts the player in the shoes of a single man in his late 20s with one thing on his mind. The player's sage choices from options presented will inform just how bad the bad decisions get, and thus how much (and what quality of) beer and women the character will end up partaking of. Though the designers' intentions are humourous, and though the game is set in (a somewhat exaggerated version of) the real world, players should choose carefully, since failure and even death await the makers of the baddest bad decisions.

sample_screenshots.caption: This looks like an ending, but this plotline has a bit more life left in it...
Not the fantasy you had in mind...

title: Beer, Women and Bad Decisions

description:
Romance author Mima has published a trilogy of three choose-your-own-adventure books (the "Take Control" trilogy) in her preferred genre: dark, erotic romance. They are available in a variety of formats (book, Kindle, Nook, PDF) but the one of the three that interests us here is the iPhone version of Charlotte, the only one of the three released in on that platform.

The basic premise explored in this gamebook adaptation is that single Charlotte, wanting to light a fire in her love life, buys a ticket on a swinging cruise ship trip to the Caribbean. Unbeknownst to her, the sailing she ends up securing passage on is hosting a very exclusive party, populated by supernatural monsters who walk among us but live apart from us, with distinctive appetites and passions all their own. The swollen moon low in the Atlantic sky also awakens some latent mystical powers in Charlotte herself, such that she can give as good as she can take.

The story can work through itself in any of eleven different ways, with some romantic successes, some erotic ones, and some downright humiliating failures, all informed by the author's selection of options presented at junctures in the textual narrative.
title: Charlotte: Prowling for Enchantment

description: So, you're designing a game for a device that fits in your hand and has an accelerometer. What do you do with it? Well, since there is no activity that can't be "gamified" by scoring one's performance at it, if you're the author of this game you make a salt-shaker simulator. Three play modes measure how much simulated salt you can simulate shaking out under 15-second (Beginner), 45-second (Hard) or untimed (Endurance) durations.
title: Grain of Salt

description: Like WIN32.DLL before, this game simulates a display being cluttered and ultimately overtaken by pop-up windows. (Unlike the earlier title, here the culprits aren't the operating system itself, but apparently the inane chatter of instant messaging, here represented by tired aphorisms.) The player's task is to dismiss them all by tapping on each window's "OK" button -- but be careful not to slip and hit "Cancel" or a barrage of further windows will appear! In the end even the fastest player will be buried beneath idle chatter -- the game is played for high score, to see how many windows can be dismissed before the computer screen fills up and grinds to a halt.
title: Popup Killer

description: Grandma's obnoxious pug Samson needs to be taken on a walk, and the task naturally falls on the player in this choose-your-own narrative.
