But the everyday account of a dog being taken on a walk would hardly make intriguing grist for a escapist adventure, and so the plot demands thickening by a cat, that Samson is naturally and instinctively drawn to pursue. Not just any cat, mind you, but an intergalactic cat, so when it runs from Samson it can traverse great distances... across which it an be pursued. Some of the widely varied perils this cat can lead the player and Samson through include such hazards as pirates, witches and even the galactic patrol... not bad, but can the player get Samson back home to Grandma in time for supper?
title: The Adventure of the Intergalactic Cat

description:
Puzzle Soccer features classic arcade gameplay of the 1980s and revisits it in soccer theme. The goal of the game is to clear stages, matching three or more balls of the same colors. Player controls a pointer at the bottom of the screen, represented by a soccer player. This can be controlled in two different game modes:

  • Tap Mode - Tapping on the stage to kick the ball in the point where player wants to direct the ball.
  • Slide Mode: Sliding finger under soccer player area, changing arrow direction.

Initially game offers a choice of sixteen national teams and fifteen levels to face before achieving final victory.

Puzzle Soccer has some additional mechanics such as the "Bomb Ball" that destroy all the balls nearby, regardless of color and the "Rainbow Ball" that changes the color of hit balls.
title: Puzzle Soccer

description:
Scribblr is a social drawing game that combines drawing with how well players know their friends. Players have the option of connecting to Facebook or using the application as is.

As a standalone application, users are prompted to draw a variety of things about themselves. An example of this might be, "Draw yourself soaring through the clouds on a magical unicorn." By connecting to Facebook, players' friends are pulled into the mix for even more fun; for instance, "Draw Tony soaring through the clouds on a magical unicorn."

Prompts come in a variety of shapes and sizes, and encourage players to be silly, playful, and imaginative. It's possible to score points for drawings.

Scribblr features posting to Facebook, sharing with friends, saving to library, and line-smoothing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now, if I want, I can publish this.

title: Scribblr

description: Today I Die Again is a completely rewrite of the 2009 browser game Today I Die. This new version still holds all basic gameplay elements, but has new scenes (and words to choose from), overhauled visuals, and revised gameplay. It also relies on the touchscreen interface, for instance allowing players to drag around a word, while touching a monster with another finger to make it disappear.
title: Today I Die Again

description: miCoach Football features a single player football game of 4 vs 4 in an urban pitch. It doesn't follow strict football rules since the user can perform special actions called 'powerups' like slow down the enemies, steal the ball from a distance or change the match time. Controls are standard when compared with other similar products: The user can shoot, pass or sprint when attacking, and change player, steal the ball or sprint when defending. Users can select different stadiums to play in, and AI teams are automatically generated. The game goes together with an app which allows the user to synchronize the iPhone with the adidas speed cell to upload real workout data into the device and increase the game values of the players during the match.
title: miCoach Football

description: miCoach Running is a simulator of jogging for the iphone. The user is required to tap alternatively on the screen to make his runner move forward, and adapt the tapping speed to a pre-defined zone where he needs to stick to. On a time basis arcade-style minigames are triggered to break the basic gameplay. There is no other goal than beat previous records. The game also offers support for the adidas speed cell, a real-life sensor which turns workouts into in-game bonuses for the user.
title: miCoach Running

description: MewMew Tower is a game where the player must pick cats from a hot-air balloon and stack them up to reach the sky. The higher the tower of cats gets, the bigger the score. The more cats are being added, the more the balance of the tower starts to tilt dangerously. The player can use the accelerometer of the iPhone to try to maintain the balance of the tower before it falls.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cats come in various colors and sizes.
Try to stack up 8 meters of cats in real-life some day...
Time to start picking cats from the balloon.

title: MewMew Tower

description: Hungry Turtle is a physics based puzzle game with cartoonish graphics. The goal in the game is to move a turtle to an apple in each of the 2D levels. The objects in the levels can be manipulated in 3 ways: cut through them, fix them with nails or drop other objects on them. The amount of actions available varies with each levels. Scoring is based on the time required to finish a level as well as the amount of actions used.
title: Hungry Turtle

description: The player takes the role of a penguin trying to collect enough snowflakes to make his very own snowball. The game is controlled by tilting the iPhone/iPod Touch in order to slide the penguin across the ice and keep him alive. This is made difficult by the fact that the floor is capable of crumbling underneath the player's penguin, plunging them to their doom.
title: Snowball

description: Adventures of Marshal Marshmallow is a first-person side-scrolling shooter set in a cartoonish Wild West where the characters are shaped as marshmallows. The player controls Marshal Marshmallow as he tries to save each town. The screen scrolls horizontally automatically and the player taps the screen to shoot opponents that appear from windows and from behind or on top of buildings. There are also innocent people that pop up and need to be left alone. The gun needs to be reloaded regularly by tapping it on the left side of the screen. Objects such as barrels and crates can also be shot. Pick-ups include health, ammo and dynamite. There are four towns and three daylight settings.
title: Adventures of Marshal Marshmallow

description: Kyumi Puzzle is a 2D item matching puzzle game. The objective is to remove all the items from the screen in each level. Items can be removed by tapping on them when they are in an adjacent group of two or more similar items. The order of removal is key to beating each level so some strategy is involved. The game features a full depth undo history so you can explore different strategies quite easily to crack each of the thirty levels.
title: Kyumi Puzzle

description: Ride or Die is a top-down action game where the player takes control of a bicyclist riding against freeway traffic. The player must maintain the cyclist's health and reach a certain distance while obtaining a certain amount of currency each level. Every third play session has a boss at the end where the player must attack weak points at specific intervals. Risk versus reward is a constant element in the game. The player must balance safety and still make a dangerous effort to gain coins and power-ups.
title: Ride or Die

description:
Ultimate Battle Zombies is a turn-based game where players pit their zombies against another player's zombie. Fighting is similar to rock paper scissors in that each player chooses 3 high, medium, low or special attacks and 3 high, medium or low blocks. When each player has taken their turn the round plays out. Battles continue back and forth until one of the two zombies is knocked out.

Each zombie has unique special moves, upgrades they can purchase, and powerups that can be used in battle. These range from increased attack power, defense or more hit points.
title: Ultimate Battle Zombies

description: This animation-heavy monster-training game owes more than a little to Pokemon. Players will be grinding away trying to train up the level of their selected Mino (apparently a kind of charismatic combat pet associated with an element) through combat after combat initiated from an overhead map while tooling around trying to resolve wholly nominal quests. Combat is a blizzard of gathering as bonuses fall from stricken opponents -- bonuses that help offense, defense, and the furthering of overall objectives.
title: MinoMonsters

description:
Liberty Wings is a shooter set during World War II where the player controls a plane. The game mixes three distinctly different game styles. There are four different locales and they can be played in each game type, providing 12 levels in total.

In the first one the game is shown from a top-down view with gameplay similar to 1942. In these vertically-scrolling missions the plane shoots automatically. The goal is to take out enemies in the air and on the ground while picking up items. A big red icon in the top right side of the screen is filled up gradually. Once it turns green, a bomber can be called to sweep the area with additional offensive means.

The second game type offers free-roaming top-down gameplay. The plane can be steered freely in any direction to shoots opponents. The goal in these missions to take out specific targets by bombing them with a secondary weapon. There is a large white cross-hair that helps aiming. Surviving is also determined by collecting different health pick-ups to last as long as possible.

The third game type is a horizontally-scrolling shooter shown from with a 3rd-person side view.

Next to the campaign mode there is a free mode and started games can be continued. Controls are available through touch and tilt, or using a virtual D-pad. The game has been made available for free and for a small fee during certain periods, but there are three types of commercial in-app purchases:* Unlimited life

  • Additional map
  • All Maps pack
title: Liberty Wings

description: In Bop It! Smash the player must trap the light in the center trapper. Doing so earns points for score, and coins used to purchase powerups and upgrades available in the game. As the game progresses the light moves faster and it travels different paths around the screen. In game items are available to change the look of everything in the game, make the trapper bigger, provide an extra life and more.
title: Bop It! Smash

description: Undercover: Girls of Cobra Mission is a simple action game with puzzle elements, featuring characters from the adult role-playing game Cobra Mission. The private investigator JR Knight returns to Cobra Island and must liberate young and pretty women from the evil General Kaiser. The game is divided into single-screen overhead stages, on which the player navigates JR in four directions, trying to avoid roaming enemies. Each stage hides an anime-style picture of a girl underneath it. The goal is to uncover at least 80% of that picture within a time limit by cutting out rectangular portions with JR's path. Enemies trapped inside the uncovered rectangle disappear. Enemies and hazards include thugs, guards, bombs, ninjas, and tanks. Collecting clocks extends the time limit, but changes the picture's visual style into "super-deformed".
title: Undercover: Girls of Cobra Mission

description: Mikado Defenders is a tower defence game based in feudal Japan. The object of the game is to defend the castle of each real world location of Japan from hordes of demons. Successfully defending a location opens up a new one and a fully upgraded castle before the final wave provokes a bonus boss wave. There are only a limited number of places; units can be placed however so strategy plays a big part. The units available are swordsmen, archers, spearmen, and cannons. Each unit can also be levelled up at a cost. The game also features many commanders to be unlocked through defeating the bosses, that can then be allocated to units and give them an added bonus and gain themselves exp at the end of the level.
title: Mikado Defenders

description:
Zombocalypse has come, and as one of the last survivors, the president of the USA, the player must try to survive.

A comic of zombies is a 2D side-scrolling shooting game starring Obama with comic-like art. Just shoot, kill zombies and reload. Stay alive in a never ending fight for survival. Level by level the player earns cash by killing zombies and can buy up to twelve different weapons (only two weapons can be carried per level though) and ammunition.

Each level introduces new enemies and new challenges.
title: A comic of zombies

description: Unstoppable Fist is a retro-styled game where the player controls Fist, a hero called from beyond the stars who has come to Earth to answer our desperate cry for help. He attempts to survive as long as possible against never ending waves of evil monsters. He is centered in the middle of the screen and cannot be moved around. Each side of the screen is based into three touch zones (top, middle, bottom) that can be tapped to punch or kick the incoming enemies. Tapping two opposite zones allows for a double attack. Swiping up or down performs a power move, but temporarily slows down Fist. The game has three different locations, each with their own enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: An enemy appears on the right.

title: Unstoppable Fist

description: Number Jumper Deluxe is a fast-paced tile-matching game and a reworked version of the browser game Number Jumper. There are two game modes "level up" and "time attack". The modes are split into two variants "2 some" and "3 some", where the goal is to match two and three tiles respectively. Multipliers are awarded for successive matching. The objective is to line up two or more of the same number horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Every time a move is made, two new numbers appear, so each one needs to be planned very carefully. The numbers are only nominal in nature and most likely are included to help discriminate between different colored blocks.
title: Number Jumper Deluxe

description:
This compilation celebrates 250.000 downloads of the game by bundling the two games in the series:* Magnetic Joe

  • Magnetic Joe 2
title: Magnetic Joe Bundle

description: In Alcatraz Breakout the player leads a band of convicts who attempt at escaping the infamous Alcatraz prison. Once the route to safety is drawn on screen, the task is to go unseen past patrolling guards. In order to that, a variety of expediencies such as hiding behind boxes or walls, using items, wearing a guard uniform, can be of help. The game is displayed by a top-down perspective.
title: Alcatraz Breakout

description: High Noon is a first-person shooter with a western theme. The game is free-to-play and monetizes through in-game micro transactions. The game's most distinct feature is the "your phone is your gun" play-style whereby players have to unholster their iPhone with physical movement at the beginning of every duel. Players can compete against each other in duels and entire of factions of players through their games gang system. To date, there are four gun types with many guns in each game type and many pieces of special equipment, including dynamite, lassos, silver bullets, voodoo dolls, wooden teeth, and more.
title: High Noon

description: Morphs: Cloud Kingdom, the sequel to Morphs, is an RPG in the vein of the Pokémon games where players choose pets, which they nurture, care for, and train so they can evolve and morph, learning new attacks and abilities. The new and improved pets are taken on adventures and receive quests to find the missing king of Cloud Kingdom. In addition to an RPG storyline, Morphs also has portions for PvP battles, minigames, and offers the option to collect several varieties of morphs to train for battle. PvP battles are played in real-time. The exploration part of the game is shown from an isometric-style view with tiles to travel around a map. Battles are shown from a sideview where the morphs take turns attacking and defending.
title: Morphs: Cloud Kingdom

description: DrawRace is a racing game viewed from a top-down perspective. Rather than having direct control of the car, the game is played by drawing lines onto the race track that the car then follows. To be able to win the race against the AI drivers, the most efficient route has to be found. At the same time it's important to maintain the right speed when approaching corners to avoid skidding out. To decrease the speed the player simply make slower motions. Once the player has drawn the route the race begins and from here he has no control over the action. The game features 20 tracks against AI drivers in single player. The player can then compare his best results against other players on the national or global leaderboards. The game can also be played in multiplayer either online or locally. When playing locally up to three player take turns drawing their routes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out with the tutorial track

title: DrawRace

description:
Challenge! is a strategy game for two players, and is based on the classic board game Agon. The board has five concentric rings of cells and a throne at the center. Each player has a queen and six guards. The game is won by putting the queen on the throne, surrounded by all six guards. The game is however lost if all guards are on the inner ring but the queen is not on the throne.

The pieces are initially placed in a symmetric pattern on the outer ring. The players take turns moving one piece. Each piece can be moved to an adjacent cell on the same ring or on the next ring closer to the throne. The cell moved to must be vacant. Only the queen can be moved to the throne. A piece cannot be moved "into capture".

A piece is captured if it has enemy pieces on two adjacent sides in a straight line. When a piece is captured, the owner must relocate it on his turn, to the outer ring if it´s a guard, anywhere on the board if it's the queen. When several pieces are captured, they must be relocated one by one, first the queen if relevant, then the guards in any order.
title: Challenge!

description:
Booty Blocks is a block-matching puzzle game with a pirate theme. In the tradition of Tetris, the screen consists of a single-screen area where blocks drop down from the top. The blocks are crates of different materials/colours (making it accessible for the colourblind) with the sea as a backdrop. Players direct the blocks down to stack them together. When five blocks or more of the same type connect in a group vertically or horizontally, they can be double tapped to make them disappear, making room for new ones. Matches are rewarded with booty in the form of coins that add to the score and combos are also possible.

Sometimes metal blocks drop down that only get in the way. Dynamite can be used to get rid of them, to blow up neighbouring crates, or they can be diffused for additional booty. There are three skill levels and all of them have the speed go up after time. Next to tapping, the device can also be tilted to fill in the gaps between the crates or create new gaps, sliding them from one side to the other. New players have access to tutorials to explain the mechanics.
title: Booty Blocks

description: In this game the player has to defend his castle from waves of enemies. He can do that by flicking away enemies with his finger, using traps and monsters he has bought against his foes, or casting various spells by using natural gestures (for example drawing a circle to spawn a rolling boulder, a jagged line to make a lightning bolt, or a V shape to summon a tornado). The emergent gameplay arises from the fact that all enemies interact with each other - for example, wild boars are enslaved by their masters and the player can free them, causing wild boar rampage in the enemy lines; sorcerers die in a light explosion that blinds other enemies, falling trolls can crush others with their weight, fire skeletons melt frozen enemies, etc. To recap, it's not a difficult game, but it tries to keep surprising the player with the interactions between the enemy units and the new spells and traps the player can unlock.

sample_screenshots.caption: A freed boar brings vengeance upon his captors
The warlock casting a mind control spell on two wild boars
Goblins - some are frozen with an ice spell, others are turned into statues with the griffin's spell
You can buy some deadly pets and help them grow

title: Castle Frenzy

description:
Snake 2k is a faithful recreation of the game Snake found on most Nokia cell phones from the 1990's complete with dot matrix screen and monotone sounds. The game features controls which emulate the keypad from a Nokia 3310, where the snake is controlled with the 2, 4, 6 and 8 buttons.

The goal is to eat as many pellets and mice as possible so the snake can grow longer and longer. The game will be over when the snake hits either a wall or its own body.

The game can be played either in a standard open level or in one of several labyrinths. It also features adjustable difficulty settings and a permanent high score system. There's also the option to upload scores to global leaderboards via GameCenter.

sample_screenshots.caption: Eat that mouse before it escapes! (Free version with ads)
Ouch! I hate when that happens... (Free version with ads)
Starting off small. (Free version with ads)

title: Snake 2k

description: Sea Snake is a variation of the classic Snake game. Players move the snake around collecting segments to make its body grow. When nine are collected, the next level is reached and to advance to the next round twenty levels need to be reached. As in the original game the snake has to avoid running into walls or itself. The game has accelerometer support and introduces pick-ups, enemies, and different types of level design. Coins and jewels can be collected for additional points. For every 100 points an extra life is granted. There are ten levels in total.
title: Sea Snake

description:
Mr.AahH!! is a 2D platforming game where the the player's timing and precision skills are put to the test. In this game, you play the titular character whose main goal is to progress the game's levels by swinging and jumping onto platforms of different shapes and sizes, gradually getting more difficult to land on. In order to progress, the player needs to tap the screen once for Mr. AahH to launch a rope into the ceiling, causing him to swing towards the platform. Then, at the right moment the player needs to tap again to release him and get him to land; not timing your taps correctly can lead to your character to miss the platform and lose a life.

Not only do the platforms become thinner and further apart, but natural forces are also working against you, causing elements such as wind force and gravity to change at nearly every stage, causing the way you jump to constantly change. Players have only 3 lives to land on as many platforms as possible in a game with over 20 levels of varying difficulty.
title: Mr.AahH!!

description:
Max Injury lets the player use the touch screen in order to launch and guide a crash test dummy named Max to the end of every level, while seeking the highest possible score. Points can be obtained by causing Max to hit and crash into as many obstacles (such as boxes and traffic cones) with extreme force as possible on the way to the end of each level. There are a total of 16 levels in this 3d ragdoll physics-based game.

The player has to swipe their finger across the screen to give Max the first push towards the exit. Some of the levels also include a power gauge that determines how far and high Max can fly, making timing and precision important aspects in some stages of the game. If Max's body is stuck on an obstacle or can't make it any further, the player has a few extra chances to tap the screen to fling him further. Once all these chances are gone, the player will have to reset the level and try again. Max Injury utilises an online global hi-score system, giving players around the world the chance to compete with the highest scores for each of the levels.

In addition to Max's original appearance, two other outfits are available from the beginning of the game: a teddy bear outfit and a zombie outfit. These costumes only have a cosmetic use, however, and so they don't affect the gameplay and physics of Max Injury. This game also has another comical feature, in which the player can replace Max's face with any image saved image or photo, giving players the chance to make their friends (or enemies, of course) go through all of the tough and hazardous stages that Max Injury has to offer.
title: Max Injury

description: Taxiball is like a cross between Crazy Taxi and a labyrinth marble-maze game. By tilting your iPhone, you guide the taxiball around the maze-like city but you must also roll over passengers to pick them up then, guided by the arrow on screen, get them to their stop.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your score. You can choose a new city, try this city again, exit to the start menu, or see the leader boards.
The checkerboard area is your destination

title: Taxiball

description: In Sonic at the Olympic Winter Games Sonic the Hedgehog and friends go to Vancouver, Canada and participate in the 2010 Olympic Winter Games (it seems Mario and friends were busy during these particular events). The game is controlled via the touch screen and tilting your iPhone or iPod Touch. Events in this game include Skeleton, Curling, Figure Skating, Snowboard Cross. Playable characters include Sonic, Dr. Eggman, Amy, Knuckles, Blaze, Tails, Shadow, Vector, and two unlockable characters.
title: Sonic at the Olympic Winter Games

description: Based on the popular 1989 horror movie that was adapted from the Stephen King novel, it has a desperate father bury his dead child in an ancient animal burial mound which brings them back to life. However, it's only meant for animals and humans return as evil zombies that seek human flesh. You play as a hero on a rooftop from a top-down view protecting townspeople from vicious creatures that emerge undead from the Pet Semetary. You shoot undead birds, cats, dogs and humans by tapping them one to four times before they bite their victims. If a townsperson is killed by a creature or by you accidentally doing them in, or a creature escapes, your health will diminish. Make your way through 15 ever more difficult levels to beat your high score. You can collect dropped bonuses and also share your high score with friends on Facebook.
title: Pet Sematary

description: Based on the sci-fi horror movie of the same name released in 2009, you play as Corporal Bower who wakes on the interstellar spaceship Elysium with limited memories only to find dangerous creatures roaming the halls. This action-adventure has you explore the 3D environments to discover what really happened on the ship while acquiring healing and bonus items and varying weapons to protect yourself. Solve puzzles through 5 levels including a mini-game puzzle where you connect electrical circuits in a correct path which provides the charge to unlock certain doors. Collect 10 different medals. An in-app purchase can provide you more weapons, a stronger suit, unlimited ammo, and lets you share the upgrade features and game progress with other players via Bluetooth. Facebook Connect will allow you to post your best times and compare with your friends.
title: Pandorum

description:
The world in ZombieHunter [7DA] has a problem: a virus broke out which turns humans into zombies. Fortunately Dr. Kayle Cupper has found a potential solution, but requires seven days to develop and synthesize the cure. There are text overlays before every chapter, but overall the story plays a little role.

Regarding gameplay, this is a classical twin-stick shooter: the movement of the player character and the direction of her weapon (the usual selection of guns, shotguns, chainsaws, etc.) is controlled independently. Because of the limitations of the platform, the game is controlled with virtual joysticks. In each of the chapters the player has to solve certain objectives like protecting scientists or collecting items; of course all while fighting a lot of zombies. The game can be either played in top-down view or with a fixed camera behind the protagonist's back. Additionally to the campaign there is also a survival mode in which the player tries to achieve a high-score.
title: ZombieHunter [7DA]

description: Fluxe is the concept of Tetris optimized for the touchscreen interface of the iPhone. On the right side of the screen are a series of replenishing tetronimo style blocks that the player taps to drop into the trench on the right. The strategy comes not from rotating or sliding pieces to fit perfectly, but in correctly choosing which block to drop in the first place. Because rotating and sliding blocks is not even an option, Fluxe has a very fast pace. After dying, the player is kicked into a new game with no menu in between.
title: Fluxe

description:
In Alive 4-ever Returns the player takes the role over one of four characters who trie to survive the zombie apocalypse. In its core, this game is a two-stick shooter using emulated joysticks which are used to move the character and the shooting direction independently from each other. Besides killing a lot of undead and various bosses, each of the 40 levels also has optional side quests like saving civilians which unlock more weapons and equipment (which have to purchased with found money, though). When a character levels up, it gains ability points (used to improve statistics like maximal health or defense) and skills (recharging abilities which give temporary statistical boosts). However, the player has to choose four skills which can be accessed during gameplay.

Besides the campaign, there are also two additional playing modes (which consist of surviving as long as possible against undead) and co-op multiplayer.
title: Alive 4-ever Returns

description:
Assault Squadron is a shooter of the "bullet hell" variety. The story is that the player needs to avoid an alien invasion by shooting all of them dead. In each of the six levels (which switch between vertically and horizontally scrolling), the player needs to survive long enough to reach the end and beat a boss battle. The problem with this is that there are a lot of enemies which unleash a lot of projectiles which the player should dodge in order to avoid defeat.

Before each level, the player gets to choose between one of three difficulty level (which affect the number of enemies and continues) and one of four space ships which differ in handling and weapon configuration. But of course one of the most important task is to upgrade the ship with special weapons so it stands a chance against the opposition, but after losing a life it reverts to the basic setup. Besides simply beating the levels, another challenge is acquiring a place on the online high-score list by using combo attacks. The ship can be either controlled by touch 1:1, touch 2.5:1, tilting or an virtual joystick.
title: Assault Squadron

description:
DaisyPop presents the player with a screen full of drifting flowers and meandering insects. Tapping a flower or insect pauses the motion; tapped flowers rapidly expand and tapped insects speed forward in a straight line. If an expanding flower or running insect comes in contact with another flower or insect, the chain continues. Different items have different point values, and the total value of a chain is the sum of everything in it multiplied by the chain length.

If a clover — identified with a glitter effect — is included in a chain, then something special happens either immediately (like a swarm of bees) or on the next tap (like double or triple points). Burrs stick in place when touched, so they can be positioned to make longer chains. Stuck-in-place burrs expand just like flowers.

Each item in a chain emits a seed that flies up to the total at the top of the screen. Seeds can be traded for upgrades on the Seed Swap screen. Some upgrades increase point values. Some add new special events to the clover. And some modify the core gameplay, such as a watering can of growth formula that can be used once per game (it increases the size of all flowers on the screen).

DaisyPop is unusual in that there's no time pressure, and patience — waiting for good alignments of flowers — is rewarded.
title: DaisyPop

description:
Breakspin is a Breakout variant. The spin of this version is that the player's two paddles (there is also an alternate option to use only one) move along a circle and the microbes, the game's stand-in for destructible blocks, are in the middle. The basic goal is to let a ball destroy all the microbes (by hitting them) and bouncing it between the paddles so it does not leave the circle.

Some of the microbes leave behind power-ups after being destroyed which give positive effects when collected with the paddles. Other microbes have special powers, e.g. some have the power to regenerate microbes around them and others shoot at the paddles (and each hit has devastating effects on the time limit). Biohazards are special abilities, e.g. the ball makes more damage within a specified field, which the player can activate at any time if enough energy is left (which fills up after finishing levels).

Besides the 48 regular levels, there is also a time attack mode with a special countdown which is extended with each microbe hit.
title: Breakspin

description:
After centuries of man's abuse, the spirit of the Earth has created soldiers, called Valkyrias, to eradicate mankind from the face of the world. Al the Valkyrias but one agree to this plan. That one decenter being you. You still see some hope for mankind and have chosen to fight against the other Valkyrias in defense of man.

Danmaku Unlimited is an action shooter of the style often called "bullet Hell". You move your ship about the screen by touch with your guns always firing. Your guns fire in a spread pattern but you can touch a spot on the screen to focus everything into one beam. If you are hit or touch the required button, a bomb will go off that damaged all enemies on screen. By killing enemies, you fill your trance meter. When this is full, you will enter trance mode, which protects you from one enemy shot and your shots are more powerful. By killing enemies, you can collect tokens that can be used in the shop to upgrade.

sample_screenshots.caption: I set off one of my bombs

title: Danmaku Unlimited

description: Stop the Clock is a simple skill game. Press the start button and numbers rapidly scroll, sequentially, from zero upwards. Press the stop button to try to stop the number right on one thousand.

sample_screenshots.caption: Press the start button to start the numbers
When you're ready, press the stop button

title: Stop the Clock

description:
THE iDOLM@STER Mobile i is a mobile game in THE iDOLM@STER series. It is the successor to THE iDOLM@STER Mobile. In this game, rather than train idols to perform, the focus is on idol promotion. The player chooses one of 13 available idols from 765 Production and works to make her famous across Japan by gaining lots of fans. This is accomplished by the player physically visiting locations. Job offers appear at locations, and the idol earns fans by completing an event. There are 505 locations spread across 47 prefectures. Registering for an account is necessary to play the game.

Additionally, there is an augmented reality photo feature that lets the player take pictures of the idols over a backdrop of the real world, a built-in Twitter client that lets players chat with one another, and a clock where the current idol will tell the player what time it is.

sample_screenshots.caption: Haruka Amami is the first idol you'll meet, even before you log in.

title: The iDOLM@STER: Mobile i

description: NekoChan Baby HERO is a side-scrolling real-time puzzle game, somewhat similar to Lemmings, where you must guide two baby ninjas to the exit of the level. You can give them just a few basic commands - to start walking, change direction and to jump - beyond that you have to manipulate the environment to ensure their passage. By tapping on the touchscreen you can move around walls, reverse conveyer belts, unlock doors and do other actions to alter the way they move around the level. At least one baby has to survive to the end to unlock the next level, but to get a perfect rating both must leave as well as collect the three coins placed in each level.
title: NekoChan Baby HERO

description: Trivy is a trivia game. The game is free-to-play and comes with the general trivia pack already installed. Once you start the game, a question will appear with four possible answers. All you need to do is touch the correct answer. You have a time limit of fifteen seconds per question. After so many correct questions in a row, you reach a checkpoint. If you miss a question, you drop back to the last checkpoint, although the questions do not repeat. When you reach certain checkpoints, you are rewarded with in-game coins. You can use these in-game coins or real-world money to acquire additional question packs.

sample_screenshots.caption: The introduction and what your helpers do
Title and main menu with General Trivia pack loaded
I missed a question so my streak ended

title: Trivy

description: Alice's Adventures: Rabbit Hole of Death is loosely based on the novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll. As Alice, here dressed in lingerie, falls down an endless rabbit hole, the player uses touch controls to move around her limbs so she fits through shaped obstacles while falling down the rabbit hole. During her fall which is shown from a top-down view, Alice can pick up a variety of items, such as healing potions, a white rabbit that grants 1000 points or a skull rabbit that takes away 500 points.
title: Alice's Adventures: Rabbit Hole of Death

description: iRodeo is a simple rodeo game. The player takes the role of a cowboy and has to keep hold his balance on the raging bull for as long as possible by using the iPhone's gravity sensor.
title: iRodeo

description: Get THAT Mish! is a casual fishing and raising simulation with social interaction features. The player catches Mish ("mystery fish") by selecting a fishing region, boat and lure, and tapping the screen in an indicated rhythm as soon as a Mish bites. Caught Mish are kept in an aquarium, which can be decorated with money from selling Mish. Players can upgrade their Mish by feeding and petting them.
title: Get THAT Mish!

description: Like its predecessor, OvenBreak 2 is a 2D side-scrolling endless runner/auto-run platformer. It abandons the hook mechanic of the first game, but adds a double jump to the familiar jump and slide moves. The hero GingerBrave is joined by a variety of other gingerbread men, so-called Breakers, with different designs and abilities: for example, GingerBright runs 10% slower, GingerClaus gains twice as much experience points, NinjaBread starts with 3 shields and has the ability to triple jump. Collecting the letters that spell BONUS now leads to a special bonus round. Furthermore, the Breakers are followed by "Charms" which aid them in several ways, and players can use in-game currency to buy boosts like shields and score multiplicators before each run.
title: OvenBreak 2

description:
Rad Skater Apocalypse is a retro-inspired indie-punk game set on the streets of Fitzroy, Melbourne, Australia. You play as a hipster scooting along the street on your skateboard just at the moment that 8-bit invaders start breaking through into our reality, to take revenge for the beating they got in the arcades of the '80s.

It is an endless skating game where the character collects mix tapes and avoiding and dispatches a variety of arcade-inspired enemies such as flashing space invaders, alley cat dogs, pixelated zombies, and strange Dalek-like mini-bosses. More enemies and powers are unlocked by achieving high scores.

It is a commercial game unlike the later-released free-to-play version Rad Skater Apocalypse Boom!
title: Rad Skater Apocalypse

description: Brodlzottn is an endless 2D runner game about a patch of hair escaping an evil shaver. The protagonist "Brodlzodi" has no feet and uses his dreadlocks to move forward. The game is played via touch controls. The longer Brodlzodi can escape the shaver the higher the score. There's an online highscore showing the best players.
title: Brodlzottn

description: Burglar Busters is a simple touch action game where the player has to capture burglars by tapping on them as they run across the screen, while avoiding to stomp on innocent poodles.
title: Burglar Buster

description:
Bust-A-Move is the first appearance of the classic puzzle series on the iPhone. It offers a unique control scheme adapted to the platform and several game modes know from earlier entries, but with a unique set of levels.

Gameplay follows the standard model of the series: the player controls a catapult at the bottom of the screen that shoots randomly colored bubbles into the play field. When three or more bubbles of the same color touch, they are removed. The catapult can be controlled in two different ways: in Sling Shot mode, the catapult direction is manipulated directly, with a "pull back" motion used to launch. In Tap Shot mode, the catapult is aimed automatically by touching its targeted location on the screen, then touching the catapult to fire.

The included game modes are Story, Challenge and VS. Story mode consists of six worlds that series hero Bub traverses on a map. Each consists of several sub-stages which in turn consist of five puzzles to complete. The goal in each level is to clear the pre-set pattern of bubbles. Challenge mode is an unwinnable endless mode played for high score, in which new bubbles are continuously added from the top. VS mode is a two-player mode played via bluetooth connection. In this mode, popping many bubbles at once adds them to the opponent's play field.
title: Bust-A-Move

description: Pandadog's Pizza is a concentration action game based on the web animation series Pandadog. The player has to deliver pizza to a variety of characters in a given time. Orders include up to three deliveries at a time. Some can be delivered in any order, while other times the order is prescribed. The player has to find the correct characters by scrolling between four different screens and then tapping on them. Points in form of a tip are given depending on the speed of the delivery.
title: Pandadog's Pizza

description:
Dark Shrine is a 3D dungeon crawl action RPG. In the shoes of a demon prince named Leinhart, the player explores the eponymous Dark Shrine. Regular attacks and combos are performed by swipe commands, while tapping on a place on the screen causes Leinhart to move there. In each level, Leinhart has to find 3 parts of a portal gem and sometimes defeat a boss to open portals to other dungeon levels, while fighting against constantly respawning enemies.

Once Leinhart has gathered enough experience, his health and mana are recharged, and the player can spend 10 skill points to upgrade his health, mana, or one of the four available spells. In addition to health and magic potions, he can also find three types of equipment: weapons, armor and jewelry.

The game also includes various unlockable mini games, such as memory or a game of tag with creatures in the dungeon.
title: Dark Shrine

description:
Neko Neko Planet is in danger. The heirs to the throne have been kidnapped and the only one who can save them is NekoChan Hero.

NekoChan HERO is an arcade-style platform game, similar to Rainbow Islands Revolution. You must guide the bubble which NekoChan Hero rides through several maze-like levels. There are obstacles, hazards and enemies you must avoid, collecting coins on the way while the timer keeps ticking down. The bubble slowly sinks but when tapping the screen it will temporarily float upwards and by tilting the phone it will glide to the left or right. You will gain powers and items on the way which you can use to help you through.
title: NekoChan HERO

description: Zenses: Rainforest for the iPhone is a remake of the Nintendo DS game Zenses: Rainforest. It only contains three of the six puzzle games from the DS version which have been recreated with new graphics and given new names. Waterfall is the same as Stack Jack from the original, Water Lily is based on Sapphire Wheel while Sunflower is a recreation of Treasure Spin. The game was released as a free app with a limited number of levels for each game. Through in app purchases it was possible to buy new levels with more than 250 levels in total.
title: Zenses: Rainforest

alternate_titles.title: ! Brain Game is designed to sharpen your math skills! For all ages! Lite

description: Pangolin is a physics-based arcade game that turns the classic platformer on its head. Instead of controlling the character, you control the platforms. Create trampolines to bounce a small curious creature though a surreal landscape filled with colorful curved slopes, sadistic spikes and teleporting targets.
title: Pangolin

description: The iOS game Super Monkey Ball 2 is a ground up remake of the original 2002 GameCube game. It features 100 levels, fifteen bonus levels and five worlds in total to explose. It also includes the mini-games Monkey Bowling, Monkey Golf and Monkey Target.
title: Super Monkey Ball 2

description: SPA 124th is a flight simulator game with dog fights set during World War I. It is based on the historical facts and accounts by members of the Lafayette Escadrille, the American Volunteer Aces of the Great War. Next to Instant Action there is a campaign with more than fifteen missions. The player gets to fly planes including Nieuport 11, Nieuport 17, Nieuport 28C, SPAD VII, SPAD XIII, and the Sopwith Strutter 1.5 Scout/Bomber. The German/Austrian Aces that need to be fought fly AVG V Bombers, Gotha 4/5 Bombers, Albatross D I, II, III, Fokker D III, Fokker DR1, Fokker D VII and more. The game also includes War Notes, historical references of all the materials (photos, 3D models, etc.) used to make the game.
title: SPA 124th

description:
You play as Frank West, a freelance photojournalist, who follows a lead to a small suburban town and soon discovers zombies have overrun the place. He ends up in a shopping mall where he has access to numerous supplies with which to fend off the countless streams of zombies.

If you succumb to the hungry masses, you can ask your friends on Facebook or Twitter to revive you. If they do, they get bonus points. If not, a zombie named for you will appear in their game. So, you can help each other continue in the game. You can move items such as tables and garbage cans to block zombies from attacking you on all sides. Eat various mall food to restore your health. Use weapons or even frying pans and golf clubs to decimate the zombie hordes.
title: Dead Rising: Mobile

description:
Resident Evil: Mercenaries VS. brings online multiplayer for the first time to iOS. Up to four people can play in a free-for-all mode via internet, Wi-Fi or Bluetooth shooting at horrible monsters as well as other players. There's also a 2 vs 2 online team match and a 1 vs a team. You have a choice of "Dock", "Fort" and "Castle" maps. In addition, there's single player Training and Coin Shooter modes. Grab ammo for your weapons, explosives, and health items like first aid aerosols.

You can choose from among these popular characters, each has a handgun plus these additional weapons: * Chris Redfield - Shotgun, Hand Grenade

  • Jill Valentine - Sub-Machine gun, Flash Grenade
  • Albert Wesker - Magnum, Shotgun (Hydra), Land mine
title: Resident Evil: Mercenaries VS.

description: Zenda: The Linked Swords is an extremely short knock-off of The Legend of Zelda series, its name evoking A Link to the Past and Four Swords. In it, you play a nameable hero (who looks suspiciously like Link but with orange clothes and hat). His goal is to find Princess Zenda, obtain a sword and gain access to the front yard of the guardsman. Once he finds Princess Zenda, he must guess her name. If he gets it right, she will give him a sword. After this, he must gather ten coins, two of which must be earned by killing purple mushroom monsters. Once link pays the guard ten coins and gains access to the front yard, which contains two recovery hearts, there is nothing left to do.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gee, I wonder if this is Princess Zenda.
A fitting name for this character.

title: Zenda

description: Dawn of the Dead is a game based on the 2004 remake of George Romero's classic zombie movie of the same name. You take refuge at the Crossroads Mall fight only to have a horde of zombies lay siege to its inhabitants. Fight a way through five levels from the parking lot to the underbelly of the mall, as you fight to survive an onslaught of bloodthirsty zombies as one of three characters: a nurse, policeman or salesman (each with different skills). Use guns in addition to axes, baseball bats, golf clubs, and unlock ever more powerful weapons. Play through Story mode first then unlock Survival mode to face waves of zombies. Difficulty levels can be adjusted for the player's ability.

sample_screenshots.caption: Retrieving the key to the mall

title: Dawn of the Dead

alternate_titles.title: Tappy Cat: Musical Kitty Collecting Rhythm Game

description:
The first online role-playing game for iPhone is based on the Watchmen movie. The year is 1975 in an alternate history where some citizens have taken up fighting crime as superheros. Create your own character with unique looks, skills and costumes and explore New York City in a real-time world with persistent game-play progress and stats. Follow an original story-line inspired by the Watchmen and complete objectives to level up your character.

Find hidden artifacts, defeat criminals and challenge other players in a strategic battle. You can chat with a thousand other in-game players. There's 5 different areas of town to explore: Downtown, Red Light District, Cemetery, Financial District, City Park.
title: Watchmen: Justice is Coming
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra - Basic Training

description:
Wizzley Presto and The Vampire's Tomb is a game in the vein of classic Dizzy and Seymour series. The player takes control of Wizzley, a bumbling wannabe magician summoned by the king to rid The Shire of some evil vampire. Wizzley's problem? He can't use any magic more complex than card tricks, and so, must complete his quest through other means, mainly a series of inventory puzzles and some rudimentary platforming.

Wizzley is controlled via directional touch-buttons on the bottom of the screen. What makes this setup rather unconventional, is that the buttons are laid out in a single raw, rather than a D-Pad. The character moves with acceleration, making it difficult to estimate the timing of certain actions, Most unexpectedly, however, the character in this platformer game can't voluntarily jump - moving platforms have to be walked on, enemies can only be avoided by walking away from them, and certain objects hurl Wizzley up in an auto-jump. To interact with puzzles and NPCs, and to pick up or use items, the player has to tap them, which can be tricky based on where on screen the hotspot is.

The game is split into three chapters, all taking place in the same locations but in two different time periods. Though the game doesn't scroll from one location to the next, the screens are given life through tiny ambient animations like birds flying in the background, or spooky eyes peering out of dark corners.

sample_screenshots.caption: Spooky cave. Gotta have a spooky cave in there somewhere.
This is where Wizzley's quest begins.
The game's very first minor puzzle is to break down this wall.

title: Wizzley Presto and The Vampire's Tomb
11eyes CrossOver: Sin, Damnation and the Atonement Girl

alternate_titles.description: New name for the original paid release
alternate_titles.title: Zombie Ball Classic

alternate_titles.description: Original title for the free release of the game.
alternate_titles.title: Zombie Ball FREE!

sample_screenshots.caption: Using booster item in campaign mode

description: Imangi is unique word construction game, as well as the first game and namesake of Temple Run developer Imangi Studios. In the game you are given a 6x8 grid of letters and are tasked with creating as many words as possible. To do this, you have the ability to shift rows of letters horizontally or vertically, however doing so can break already constructed words. The more complete words you have by the end, the higher your score will be. Certain letters marked in red will also provide bonus points if used.
title: Imangi

description: Monkey Butt is a slingshot shooter. The player uses the touch screen to pull an upside-down monkey's tail, and when they let go, the monkey shoots a coconut from its butt. The goal is to hit targets with the coconuts. In the main mode, the goal is to launch as many coconuts into the clouds as possible within 30 seconds. There are also two bonus mini-modes: Pelt the Parrot, where the goal is to hit a parrot with as many coconuts as possible in 30 seconds, and Bamboo Bounce, where targets must be hit as many times within 30 seconds, but the fired coconuts must hit a wall at least two times before hitting the target.
title: Monkey Butt

description: Terra: Eternal Chaos is a very traditional action/RPG following the adventures of a character who finds himself drawn into an ancient conflict. It features very simple action-based combat controlled using a virtual D-pad on the phone screen. Some depth is added via character customization; in addition to choosing one of several weapon classes at the beginning of the game, the player can learn from a pool of 50 skills which can be mixed and matched.
title: Terra: Eternal Chaos

description:
Sonic 20th Anniversary celebrates the anniversary of the release of Sonic the Hedgehog. Sega advertised it as a time-limited app created specifically to celebrate the anniversary year, and withdrew it from the App Store at the end of 2011.

The app's biggest attraction is the game Sonic the Sketchhog, whose international release was exclusive to this app. A simple infinite runner, it features a sketchy hand-drawn Sonic running through a cute rendition of Green Hill Zone set to a relaxing music box rendition of the first stage theme from Sonic the Hedgehog 4: Episode I. The player is scored based on the number of metres travelled, the number of rings collected, and the number of enemies defeated; an online high score list allowed players to compare their high scores with their friends.

The app's other primary gaming feature is a one-level time-limited demo of Sonic the Hedgehog 4: Episode I, which had been released the previous year. It also featured weekly free downloadable wallpapers and a news feed featuring news about Sonic's 20th anniversary.

sample_screenshots.caption: Daily wallpapers were offered as an in-app bonus during the app's lifespan; these were sized for use on iPhones of the time.

title: Sonic 20th Anniversary

sample_screenshots.caption: The text at the bottom lets us know what doll we've picked.
Filling out the musicians in the second-last row.
Opening screen - none of the dolls have been placed yet.

description: Scarlett and the Spark of Life is a point-and-select adventure game. The player controls Scarlett, a kidnapped princess who is not going to wait for a noble knight to rescue her. She is going to pick a fight and make a daring escape on a mechanical horse. Puzzles are both inventory- and dialogue-based, the latter taking up most of the time. This game was intended to be the first of a trilogy, but the other games were never released.
title: Scarlett and the Spark of Life

description:
Quiz Climber is a trivia game in which the player is a chipmunk. The goal is to reach the top of a tree by answering general knowledge questions correctly. There is no direct multiplayer, but the game features Facebook leaderboards.

The game was updated and re-released as Quiz Climber Rivals. Among the upgrades were new questions, a weekly competition and Game Center integration.
title: Quiz Climber

description:
Scarface: The Last Stand is a shooter based on the final shootout starring Tony Montana from the 1983 movie Scarface. The movie's final scene with the iconic scene in the mansion is expanded into gameplay covering 30 levels in an arcade mode along with an additional survival mode. The entire game is set in different parts of the mansion and features voice samples from the movie.

Tony Montana is moved around in a 3D environment to different spots automatically as an on-rail shooter. There are on-screen controls for both aiming and shooting. Aiming using an analogue stick on the left makes the screen scroll and can be done in any direction. Optionally auto aiming can be enabled so the player only has to focus on movement. There are also other control schemes possible. Eventually fifteen different weapons can be unlocked. The top of the screen shows the score, the current score multiplier, the remaining health, the current weapon and the remaining ammo. After each level statistics are shown.
title: Scarface: The Last Stand

description: Math-ster Frog is an iPhone educational game for children learning math. The story behind the game is about a frog, who wants to become a ninja and have to pass different challenges. The challenge starts from Addition Lesson, Subtraction Lesson, Multiplication Lesson, Division Lesson, and finally Combined Lesson. Each challenge represents an element. After collecting all elements, the frog becomes a ninja master (math-ster).
title: MATHster Frog

description:
Luma is a puzzle game where the player has to guide a beam of light to its target destination. It is played on a board of circular nodes, each which has one piece of the path. Similar to Droplitz the game is played by rotating each node so that a complete path to the target is created. The game's adventure mode consists of 30 stages and adds more gameplay elements as progress is made. This includes coloured nodes that change the path's colour. It's necessary to match the colour of the end node with the colour of the light. In some levels there are multiple colours that have to be mixed to create the correct colour.

After completing the adventure mode, a survival mode is unlocked. It has a time limit but also additional tools that can be used. This includes a clock reset and the ability to remove pieces that aren't needed from the board.
title: Luma

description: A short love story about two ordinary high school students. The unnamed protagonist is a young girl who falls in love with the new transfer student. The two decide to keep their relationship secret from the students around them; this visual novel explores their lives and their first dates.
title: Morikawa Sora no Rule

description: The year is 1999, and the apocalypse is real. Two teenagers go about their normal lives at the end of the world. Having fallen for his classmate, Kasumi Kurokawa, the protagonist goes about trying to change his life. This short visual novel takes place in a mixture of "real-world" illustrations, the protagonist's notebook, and a period-appropriate personal digital assistant.
title: '99: Kyōfu no Daiō to Hōkago no Megami

description: This remake of Morikawa Sora no Rūru expands the original visual novel with new artwork and an updated script.
title: Moriwaka Sora no Rule Sai

description: This visual novel follows a protagonist who finds themselves transported into the literary world of an author who plans to end his series. After meeting Botsuko, a girl from that world who realizes the world around them is about to come to a close, they set out together to try to find a way to save it. Its story is told via shifting art styles that evoke the concept of a fictional world in the middle of its creation.
title: Botsuneta-dōri no Kimitoboku

description:
ZX Nostalgia: Arcade Edition Vol.1. - The Mojon Twins is a free application where the author of the ZX Spectrum emulator ZX Nostalgia bundles it with a selection of games developed by the Spanish group The Mojon Twins in a single package. The games were included with their permission. All included games were previously available and free to download, but can now be played through this bundle on an iPhone through an official release.

The included games are:* Cheril of the Bosque

  • Cheril Perils
  • Drama en el barrio La Jota: ¡Co!
  • Lala: Prologue
  • Mariano the Dragon: Capers in Cityland
  • Moggy
  • Moggy Adventure
  • Nanako Descends to Hell
  • Nanako in Classic Japanese Monster Castle
  • Phantomas Saga: Infinity
  • Phantomas Tales #1: Marsport
  • Phantomasa v3
  • Phantomasa in the land of the Grunge Wizards
  • Sgt. Helmet Zero
  • Shoot Redux: Marifrisky Space Warrior
  • Sir Ababol
  • Subacuatic Reloaded
  • Uwol: Quest for Money
  • Viaje al centro de la napia
  • Zombie Calavera: Prologue

Games can be saved and loaded.
title: ZX Nostalgia: Arcade Edition Vol.1. - The Mojon Twins

description:
Ace Combat Xi: Skies of Incursion is a mobile entry in the Ace Combat series. It's a prequel to the PSP game Ace Combat X: Skies of Deception and takes place during the Aurelian War when Aurelia is invaded by Leasath. The invading forces are attacking Griswall, Aurelia's capital city, which the player has to defend by taking control over the Falco Squadron. The game's campaign originally consisted of five missions with an additional three maps being added through updates. The original version of the game had a total of five planes of which three were available from the start and the other two being unlockable by beating the game on easy and normal difficulties. Additional planes were available as DLC.

The game plays similarly to previous games in the series but uses the iPhone's accelerometer to control the planes by tilting. Touch screen buttons are used for throttle and brakes as well as firing machine guns and launching missiles. The tilt controls can be changed to an onscreen d-pad. There is also an autopilot option. Across the campaign, the player has to take down various enemies such as jets, anti-aircraft guns, and tanks. The multi-purpose gauge from Ace Combat X makes a return and is used to show the status of the enemy forces. The game can be played either from a behind view or from a cockpit view.

sample_screenshots.caption: First person view with d-pad controls

title: Ace Combat Xi: Skies of Incursion

description:
Terminator: Salvation is a third-person shooter based on the film of the same name. This version of the game was released alongside a feature phone version which it is similar to but differs in being fully 3D. The game is made up of a single-player campaign that consists of eight missions where the player gets to take of control of both John Connor and Marcus Wright, the two protagonists of the movie. After completing the full game, the option to play as a T-600 terminator is unlocked.

The game is similar to other third-person games of its time with plenty of cover-based shooting. Missions are linear and involve moving from one point to another while destroying all the enemies that appear. This includes humanoid terminators such as the T-600 as well as other robots such as spiders, the tank-like T-1 and the mech-like harvesters. Weapons include shotguns, grenade launchers, and surge cannons. In addition to the regular on-foot-levels, there are two vehicle-based levels, one with a jeep and one with a motorcycle.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using the surge cannon to hit the tanks weak spot

title: Terminator: Salvation

description: Need for Speed: Undercover is the iPhone version of Need for Speed: Undercover. The game only has a single-player story mode in which the player is an undercover cop in the underground racing scene. Missions include two-car races, four-car elimination, cop chases, and combat missions among others. Accelerating is done automatically and to steer, the player needs to tilt the screen. Tilting it more makes the car drift, and touching the screen brakes.
title: Need for Speed: Undercover

description:
Ridge Racer: Accelerated is the first entry in the Ridge Racer arcade racing release for iOS. There are few modes available to play: Arcade, Duel, Survival, Time Attack. More than half of a hundred cars are presented in the game. They are divided into several classes, each having own speed and difficulty characteristic. The courses and soundtrack are taken directly from previous Ridge Racer titles.

The game uses microtransactions to let players to unlock additional content such as more cars and courses.
title: Ridge Racer: Accelerated

description:
Dance Dance Revolution S+ is a sequel to Dance Dance Revolution S. It retains the standard mode and the shake mode from its predecessor but lacks the course mode. The gameplay is the same with touch screen arrows being used to play the game in the standard mode while accelerometer controls are used in the shake mode.

The main difference from Dance Dance Revolution S is the business model. The game was sold at a lower initial price but only included three songs. Additional song packs, each with three songs, could be bought in an in-app store. In total 222 songs were available.
title: Dance Dance Revolution S+

description:
Q: The Game is a fast-paced puzzle game about removing tiles from a field seen from a side view and a fixed screen. The goal is to score points and build combos by thinking ahead and queueing moves to then executive them in succession for the best possible result, removing as many tiles as possible. Tiles of the same colour, connected horizontally or vertically, disappear together when they are chosen. No swapping is needed.

There is only a limited amount of time to choose and queue moves as a bar on the left side of the screen fills up quickly. To keep progressing to new levels quick thinking and building up combos is required, as indicated through a bar near the bottom of the screen, showing what is needed to move on. The game keeps track of the high score. The best scores can be compared worldwide and it is possible to compete against a friend offline on a single device.
title: Q: The Game

description: Tribal Tallies is a game about tapping numbers in a numerical order as quickly as possible before time runs out. The game takes place in the fictional Tally Village where tribesmen put the player's character through their trials. Every level has the same basic concept and only takes a few seconds to complete as a bar on the side of the screen fills up quickly. But there are twists with different types of challenges such as counting stationary sheep, chasing fish that move, stacked crates where not all numbers are visible, matching pairs etc. Next to the main Adventure mode there is a Time Trial mode.
title: Tribal Tallies

description:
Backgammon Classics is a backgammon game for mobile devices that features the following game modes:

  • Quick Game
  • Tournament
  • 2-Player
  • Tutorial

The game can be played from a top-down 2D view of a 3D view where the camera can be freely rotated. It's possible to choose from different themes (classic wood, magnetic, vintage) to alter the look of the board and the pieces.
title: Backgammon Classics

description: 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa is the official mobile game of the tournament. This is the smartphone version which was released alongside a feature phone version. The game is similar to the iPhone version of FIFA 10 and uses similar touchscreen controls. Game modes include the full World Cup tournament which can be played with or without qualification, friendlies, penalty shoot-outs and the Captain Your Country mode which is similar to the Be A Pro mode from FIFA 10. The game also offers multiplayer matches over wi-fi or bluetooth.
title: 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa

description: Bomb on Pixel City is most likely a re-release of the 2011 iOS game Bomb on Pixel City. Although it lists the involvement of Alexandre Minard instead of Laurent Fontaine, both seem to be tied to the developer Gamopat Studios. It is not entirely clear if both games are completely identical or whether this an updated re-release, but the 2011 game is confirmed to have been removed from the App Store because Gamopat let the yearly license fee expire.
title: Bomb on Pixel City

description:
Rogue Planet is a futuristic turn-based strategy game. When a space crew returns to Earth after a mission of 35 years, they discover the machines have taken over. In the Story mode the crew's Nimeh ship needs to complete missions to search Earth for survivors and the story unfolds while progressing.

The turn-based missions take place on small maps that act like grids where units are moved around like chess pieces. The player can view the entire map through zooming and rotation. Strategy involves powerful commanders, various buildings, resources and units with different roles. The environment and type of terrain also play a role. Missions take place over several rounds. Owning the most buildings is a key element to winning as they generate resources each turn to build units. Buildings are colonized by sacrificing ground units.

There is also a Quick Game mode to replay any campaign from the Store mode or 50 additional maps, and there is support for local multiplayer games using Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. In multiplayer actions take place simultaneously on both screen so the opponent can see what the other player is doing. In Quick Games there are three difficulty levels and you can select a Human or Robot commander to gain specific perks.
title: Rogue Planet

description: Inferno Pool turns the classic pool game into a frantic experience where every potted ball is transported to the opponent's table. Shots are not done on a turn-based fashion, but in real-time and simultaneously. Games can be played against AI opponents or against the clock. All types of shots are supported, including jump shots and swerves. By performing skills shots an inferno mode can be activated.
title: Inferno Pool

description: Alien Blobs is an action puzzle game in the match-three genre. The player controls a character with a cannon, spinning around a pivot point where small coloured blobs appear. The goal is to create matches by shooting balls (anti-blobs) among the alien blobs to create matches, thus removing them from the area. The alien blobs are also able to shoot back. Other game elements include level bosses, aliens from the outside rushing in and mines that chase you. There are also various power-ups and collectables. There is a main game mode along with an arcade mode. The player's character is Alice, the daughter of one of a group of scientists that accidentally opened up a portal that led to an alien invasion.
title: Alien Blobs

description: BattleShip2Go is a version of the classic Battleship board game. Players place their ships on a grid and then take turns shooting squares until all ships of one the players are sunk. After the initial release the game was updated with a new feature to lay mines before the start of a match. If the opponent places a ship on one of the squares with a mine, an instant hit is scored at the start of the match. This is not a default gameplay element and it can be disabled. The game is played against a computer opponent or against another player using WiFi.
title: BattleShip2Go

description:
Can't get into Clubhouse? Why not try Crabhouse?

Players take control of a crab and hop into a small house filled with other crabs. They can move around, interact with furniture, and even with other crabs. Each crab is an actual player playing online, so as the house fills up with more people, the game becomes more chaotic.
title: Crabhouse
El of Genesis: -At the end of the hero's dream-

sample_screenshots.caption: When defending, tap a base to throw the ball

description: Before Eidos Interactive was obtained by Square Enix, the Championship Manager series was still in full play. Championship Manager 2011 was a game built specifically for Apple devices. The game takes full advantage of the touch screen to access the mailbox and drag players across the pitch. The major leagues appear in the game with the exception of the MLS. The press conferences vary.
title: Championship Manager 2011

alternate_titles.title: Daikaijū Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu: Digital Pinball

description: Based on the 2009 Ultraman crossover film Mega Monster Battle: Ultra Galaxy Legend, Ultra Legend Pinball features heroes and monsters crossing paths on the battlefield of pinball. Like other games in the Digital Pinball series, it focuses on a high degree of realism via its physics simulation and detailed 3D prerendered art.
title: Ultra Legend Pinball

description: Fire EX. is a rhythm game for promoting Taiwanese punk rock band Fire EX. (滅火器). In a pixel art environment rhythm game mechanics are used to play as members of the Fire EX. band. All the levels are based on their songs. As you progress through levels, the band members get better at performing with more skill and are able to appear on larger stages. At the end of the game, players will perform a concert tour.
title: Fire EX.

description: Baroque FPS is an action take on Sting's dark fantasy sci-fi roguelike Baroque. It adapts graphics and the setting from its console cousin while recasting the gameplay as a first-person shooter. Players are equipped with both a sword and a firearm for close and long-distance combat, and are able to fire their weapons simply by tapping on the screen.
title: Baroque FPS

description: Fix Me! is a simple sliding puzzle game. The game includes two difficulties: "Level 1", which features a 3x3 puzzle; and "Level 2", which features a 4x4 one. The game can use images from a variety sources for the puzzle, including ones saved to the player's device.
title: Fix Me!

description: Caramella Girls is a mobile rhythm game featuring the popular Eurodance song "Caramelldansen". In the game the player has four touch screen buttons: a red square, a blue triangle, a green cross, and a purple circle. During gameplay, control goes back a forth between the game and the player, with the game showing a pattern on the bar at the top of the screen, which the player then has to repeat using the four buttons. If the player fails to do so correctly they lose power, while doing so correctly replenishes their power and adds to their score. The game has three difficulty levels and only one song, Caramelldansen, though the song is available in three different languages that are selectable in the game's settings.
title: Caramella Girls

description: Double Dragon is a remake of the arcade classic beat 'em up. Similar to the earlier version for Zeebo, it features updated gameplay with a new, much more detailed fighting game-like combo system similar to Knights of Valour and Sengoku 3 along with highly detailed character sprites inspired by The King of Fighters. Compared to the earlier Zeebo game, this game features revised character sprites, completely new backgrounds, and an updated combo system. It also features several entirely new stages that weren't in the previous versions and an EXP system so that players' progress persists between runs.
title: Double Dragon

description:
Touch Hockey is a mobile air hockey game. Using touch screen controls, the players use their mallets to shoot the puck into the opponent's goal. The first player to reach the set point limit wins the game. The game's difficulty can be modified by changing the size of each player's goal.

The game can be played against the AI in single player, or against another player on the same device or over bluetooth or wifi.
title: Touch Hockey

description: Save Your Legs is a mobile game based on the Australian movie of the same name. It follows the Abbotsford Anglers cricket team on a journey through India, with stops on the way to play a "cricket" game with produce. This game is very similar to Fruit Ninja; as food is launched through the screen, players must slash through the screen via drawing lines in order to cut it.
title: Save Your Legs

description: The iPhone version of the 2008 web game Fantastic Contraption includes the original's 21 levels as well as an All Star Pack of 20 additional levels. It was launched with the introductory price of $ 2.99.
title: Fantastic Contraption

description:
Anibabe! is a compilation that includes various bishoujo visual novels games created by Genius Studio.

Some stories:

  • After School Girlfriend
  • My Crazy High School Romcom!
  • My Foxy Girlfriend
  • My Nurse Girlfriend
  • My Rental Girlfriend
  • Protect My Love
  • She's My Vampire
  • Sister Splash!
title: Anibabe!

description:
Ghost’N Goblins: Gold Knights II continues the formula of the original Ghosts 'N Goblins, and is the follow-up to the previous Ghosts 'N Goblins: Gold Knights mobile game in the franchise.

As you once again battle against the minions of the Ghoul Realm, players, take control of the legendary Arthur or the powerful Perceval (substituting for Lancelot in the previous outing), who has a dash attack that can break through walls.

The game allows for microtransactions to make life easier for the player, such as unlimited lives, various powerups and removal of pitfalls and traps.
title: Ghosts 'N Goblins: Gold Knights II

description: Suitor Shooter is an orbital shooter where you attempt to stop incoming suitors that are deemed unworthy of the king's daughter by shooting them with various projectiles before they can reach the princess' tower. The game uses the same engine and base as the game Santa's Giftship, created by the same development team, but is re-skinned to be Valentine's Day-themed and includes upgrades that players can make to their weapons.
title: Suitor Shooter
